title: Informationsarkitekt och strateg inom digital samhällsbyggnadsprocess till Digital Services i Stockholm/Uppsala
description:
Ansök här
**Informationsarkitekt och strateg inom digital samhällsbyggnadsprocess till Digital Services i Stockholm/Uppsala**
===================================================================================================================

  

Som konsult inom Digital Services på Sweco får du en unik möjlighet att vara en del av en spännande resa mot att digitalisera samhällsbyggnadsprocessen. Tillsammans med engagerade kollegor får du arbeta med kommuner, fastighetsutvecklare och myndigheter för att skapa smarta och effektiva lösningar som verkligen gör skillnad. Du kommer att vara en nyckelperson i att utveckla kundrelationer och sälja in innovativa uppdrag som bidrar till en hållbar framtid.


Vill du vara med och forma framtidens samhällen? Då är detta din chans att bli en del av ett av Europas ledande konsultföretag inom teknik och arkitektur, där din insats verkligen räknas.

**Din framtida roll**


I din roll kommer du att vara informationsarkitekt och digital strateg i våra uppdrag för såväl privat som offentlig verksamhet. Du kommer att strukturera och sätta upp digitala informationsflöden och datamodeller samt leda projekt som syftar till att förbättra och effektivisera samhällsbyggnadsprocessen. Du får möjlighet att påverka och forma framtiden genom att implementera lösningar som inte bara uppfyller myndighetskrav utan också skapar bestående värde för våra kunder.


Som konsult inom Digital Services kommer du exempelvis att

* tillsammans med kollegor hjälpa våra kunder att utveckla sin verksamhet
* utveckla kundrelationer, skapa och sälja in egna uppdrag
* ha stora möjligheter att påverka framtiden.


Tillsammans med dina kollegor och våra kunder bidrar vi varje dag på flera olika sätt till FN:s globala hållbarhetsmål.


Dina uppdrag kommer exempelvis att innefatta följande (det är inget krav att behärska samtliga områden)

* Arbeta med begrepps-, informations- och datamodellering inklusive processkartläggning
* Verksamhetsutveckling och digitaliseringsledning.
* Nuläge- och behovsanalyser samt åtgärdsförslag.
* Ta fram, utveckla och implementera strategier för att tillgängliggöra och använda öppna data för att effektivisera samhällsbyggnadsprocessen.
* Leda förändringsprocesser och agera som beställarstöd inom såväl privat som offentlig verksamhet och offentlig upphandling (LoU mm).
* Projektledning, IT-projektledning och förvaltningsledning.
* Bidra till en strategisk och holistisk IT-arkitektur för att säkerställa att våra kunders lösningar blir effektiva, hållbara och framtidssäkrade.
* Strategiskt arbete kring metadata-hantering och öppna data
* Implementera, utveckla och förvalta digitala informationsflöden.
* Hantering och utveckling av datamängder inom regeringsuppdraget *Smartare Samhällsbyggnadsprocess.*
* Arbeta med befintliga och/eller ta fram nya plattformar och systemlösningar för digital samhällsbyggnadsinformation.
* Samverkan mellan olika discipliner inom samhällsplanering.
* Hjälpa våra kunder att följa aktuella regelverk med öppna data-direktivet, NIS2 och data governance.
* Utforska och implementera AI och Machine Learning-lösningar för att optimera våra processer och tjänster.

**Vem är du?**


För att passa för tjänsten ska du

* ha en högskoleutbildning eller motsvarande inom samhällsplanering gärna med teknisk inriktning
* ha arbetat mer än 4 år inom för tjänsten relevant verksamhet
* ha haft några av rollerna informationsarkitekt, verksamhetsutvecklare, projektledare, IT-projektledare, digitaliseringsledare, workshopledare
* ha erfarenheter inom några av dessa områden
	+ verksamhetsutveckling inom samhällsbyggnadsprocessen på operativ och strategisk nivå
	+ ha en dokumenterad erfarenhet inom systemutveckling, GIS/geodata eller BIM
	+ leda workshops kring nuläge och behov samt översätta till krav och åtgärder
	+ implementering av tekniska system inom informationshantering och metadata
	+ god kännedom om internationella standarder och best practice kring informationsarkitektur och begreppsmodeller
	+ informationssäkerhet, processkartläggning och verksamhetsarkitektur.
	+ strategisk IT-arkitektur.
	+ öppna data, GDPR, NIS2 och/eller data governance.
* kunna ta ansvar för dina egna handlingar, arbeta strukturerat och leda ditt arbete utifrån givna förutsättningar
* vara lyhörd för våra kunders behov och brinna för att skapa lösningar som ger bestående värde
* tycka om att utöka och underhålla ditt nätverk, i syfte att skapa affärsmöjligheter
* kunna uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska
* ha en god kommunikativ förmåga som gör det lätt för kollegor och kunder att samarbeta med dig

**Varför jobba hos oss?**


På Sweco Digital Services får du jobba i digital framkant och utvecklas tillsammans med experter som brinner för att skapa ett smartare och hållbart samhälle. Att ha kul tillsammans på jobbet och lära av varandra är viktigt för oss liksom att ha bra balans mellan arbete, familj och fritid. Vi vågar påstå att vi är en av Sveriges mest attraktiva arbetsgivare för dig som lever våra värdeord nyfikenhet, engagemang och ansvar. Bland dina framtida kollegor finner du BIM-experter, digitaliseringsledare, data- och informationssamordnare, geodataexperter, FME-experter och systemutvecklare. I Stockholm sitter vi tillsammans på Swecos huvudkontor med utsikt över hela Stockholm och har mycket utbyte mellan våra kompetensområden:

* Inom **Systemutveckling** jobbar vi med många olika tekniker och ramverk – såväl som strategiska rådgivare och med utveckling/implementation. Vi har kompetenser inom UX/design, backend- och frontend-utveckling, databaser, molnlösningar och AI/ML. Vi jobbar agilt med hela kedjan inom systemutveckling från förstudie, design/UX, prototyp till utveckling i projekt och slutlig förvaltning av lösningar. Vi är experter på lösningar som bygger på öppen källkod (t ex, Kafka, Kubernetes, QGIS och Geoserver), men vi hjälper även våra kunder med utveckling och integrationer till större mjukvaruleverantörer som Microsoft, Autodesk, ESRI, Bentley m fl. Sweco har väldigt mycket uppdrag inom dataintegration och automation med hjälp av verktyg som FME och UiPath m fl.
* Inom **BIM- och informationssamordning** jobbar vi i bygg- och infrastrukturprojekt eller åt fastighetsförvaltare. Vi arbetar med allt från att designa och automatisera processer och IT-stöd för projektstyrning till CAD-/BIM-samordning och dokumenthantering.
* Inom **GIS och geodata** arbetar vi med informationsbearbetning och -samordning, utformar och utför rumsliga analyser eller arbetar med dataflöden och tillgängliggörande av geodata. Vidare arbetar vi med organisation- och verksamhetsutveckling eller IT-arkitektur kopplat till GIS och geodata. Vi är bevandrade i GIS-branschen och har erfarenhet av verktyg som ArcGIS, QGIS och FME.
* Inom **Verksamhetsutveckling och ledning** arbetar du med affärs- och verksamhetsutveckling med fokus på hållbarhet och affärsnytta. Uppdragen har en stor variation och innefattar bland annat förstudier och verksamhetsanalyser, genomlysning och utveckling av strategier, organisation, förmågor, processer och system samt projektledning och förändringsledning. Vi använder både agila och mer traditionella arbetssätt för att genomföra våra uppdrag och vi strävar efter att välja den metod som skapar de bästa förutsättningarna för en så god och effektiv dialog som möjligt.


Självklart samarbetar vi med kollegor inom hela Sweco, både geografiskt och kompetensmässigt!


Vill du veta mer om vilka vi är se vår film https://youtu.be/0KJB2-ZjFVs

**Ansökan**


Denna annons är tidsbegränsad och riktar sig specifikt till dig som har flerårig erfarenhet av kommunal planprocess eller digitalisering av samhällsbyggnadsprocessen. Om just den här tjänsten inte passar dig har vi en mindre snäv annons ute över tiden *Intresseanmälan – Konsult till Digital Services*.


Vi återkopplar till samtliga sökanden efter avslutad rekryteringsprocess. Observera att återkoppling kan dröja på grund av ledigheter runt jul och nyår.

**Kontakta oss**


Vill du höra mer om tjänsten och hur vi jobbar i gruppen? Välkommen att kontakta:


Sara Östblom, gruppchef – sara.ostblom@sweco.se


Helena Falk, gruppchef – helena.falk@sweco.se


Ansök här
På Sweco vill vi vara en arbetsplats präglad av mångfald. Vi tror att fler perspektiv breddar vår förmåga att fortsätta nå våra mål och eftersträvar mångfald i våra rekryteringsprocesser.
  

  

Sweco planerar och utformar framtidens hållbara samhällen och städer. Tillsammans med våra kunder utvecklar våra 22 000 arkitekter, ingenjörer och andra experter lösningar för att hantera urbaniseringen, ta vara på digitaliseringens möjligheter och göra framtidens samhällen mer hållbara. Sweco är det ledande konsultföretaget inom teknik och arkitektur i Europa med en omsättning på cirka 29 miljarder SEK. Företaget är noterat på Nasdaq Stockholm. För ytterligare information, www.sweco.se
company_description: Sweco planerar och utformar framtidens samhällen och städer.

title: Web designer with UX/UI profile
description:
Applications are considered on a rolling basis Lund On-site
  
  

It's never been a more exciting time to join us at Lime! We are growing rapidly from being the CRM sweetheart of Sweden to becoming a leading provider of spot-on software for every step of the customer journey - in the Nordics and beyond. Being a SaaS company, our products are the heart of what we do, and our website is the core that brings them to life. We are now looking for a creative and business minded Web Designer with UX/UI skills to help us stand out in a competitive market.
  
  

Are you driven by crafting stunning web designs that capture the visitor at first glance, communicate the product value propositions effectively, improve navigation and increase the conversion while staying true to the brand? Great, then we’d love to hear from you!
  
  

In 2024 we launched our new brand identity and website. Now, we are rolling it out across our product portfolio to create a unified and engaging user experience. Join us on our journey to create a web presence as dynamic and ambitious as our growth targets.
  
  

What You’ll do?
  
  

This role involves taking ownership of the design and user experience of our websites, and ensuring that they align with industry trends, best practices, our various target audiences and business goals. You have a deep understanding of modern web aesthetics, responsive web design, and site architecture, with a strong emphasis on creating both visually appealing, and functional designs. Our current design is done in Figma, and we use WordPress Gutenberg as platform.
  
  

Key Responsibilities
  
  

Lead the design and harmonization of Lime’s main website and subdomains, ensuring a cohesive, scalable, and seamless user experience
  
Maintain and evolve Lime’s visual identity across all sites, retaining consistency while lifting the uniqueness of the different software products
  
Create web graphics, illustrations, and visual elements that bring the products to life
  
Develop scalable designs for how to visually present the products on different levels
  
Ensure designs are responsive, accessible, and optimized for both PC and mobile device
  
A/B testing to optimize user experience and achieve business objectives
  
Deliver designs that enhance CRO and optimized user journeys, boosting conversion rates and build lasting relationships
  
Collaborate with key stakeholders within the marketing team and other departments
  
Stay up to date with web design trends, best practices, and emerging technologies
  
Work with great people
  
Anna-Mari Ewing
  
Sales Operations Specialist
  
"If you express your ambitions and what you need, then there are really great opportunities for a career here."
  
Matilda Alm
  
Account Manager
  
"At Lime, I thrive with fantastic colleagues and an inspiring culture. Opportunities to be challenged and grow as an Account Manager make each day exciting and unique."
  
Terry Ilebode
  
Software Engineer
  
"It is all about holistic growth support in all aspects of my life. Lime not only encourages me to be a great software engineer but also provides an enabling environment to become a better person."
  
Henrik Kjærvik
  
Head of Expert Services
  
"The best thing about working at Lime, except for the people of course, is the flexibility and opportunity to develop your own career according to your own ambitions and goals."
  
Skills & Requirements
  
  

Who You are?
  
  

We imagine that you have 3-5 years of work experience as a web designer and/or digital UX/UI designer, either at an agency or at a company. If you have been active in the B2B tech or SaaS industry or had a focus on software, it is a big plus. You also have a passion for tech and software products that have a true impact of people’s everyday (work)life. You have probably studied web design, UX/UI design or similar.
  
  

We’ve always conducted our growth journey in a “professional, yet easy-going” manner and we believe that this description fits you too. You’re known for your proactive approach to generating new creative designs and executing them to drive tangible results.
  
  

What skills do you need?
  
  

Experience with CMS driven design
  
Strong understanding of responsive web design principles
  
A great eye for graphic design and a strong sense of visual design
  
Good analytical skills and a deep understanding of user behaviour
  
Proficiency in design tools such as Figma, Adobe Creative Suite or equivalent
  
Experience working with cross-functional teams in an international environment
  
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
  
Fluent in English, as it’s our corporate language
  
Knowledge of front-end technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) is a plus
  
  

Personal Qualities
  
  

**Entrepreneurial mindset:** proactive and creative, interested in trying new things, dare to test, learn and adapt
  
**Problem solver:** analytical but with a user-first approach to design challenges
  
**Collaboration:** Team player with excellent communication skills, capable of articulating design decisions clearly
  
**Strategic yet detailed:** able to balance big-picture while refining the details
  
**Self-starter:** take initiative and adapt quickly to new challenges
  
**Collaborative communicator:** good at building relationships and communicate to get people on board
  
  

Who will you be working with?
  
  

With a strong and dedicated marketing team at our headquarters in Lund, we create most of our content centrally and adapt it to our local markets with the help of a growing team of local field marketers. You will join a team of 15 people with expertise in SEO, graphic design, copy writing, web development, performance marketing, product marketing and more. We work closely together on multiple parallel projects and love to bounce ideas between each other. On top of that, we share a passion for music and just having fun together.
  
  

What will the recruitment process look like?
  
  

We would love if you could join our team as soon as possible, but we are also committed to finding the right match. During the process you will have the opportunity to meet other members of our team. Please submit your resume and a portfolio showcasing your web design projects. The recruitment process is as follows:
  
  

Initial short interview
  
Deep interview and portfolio walk-through
  
Case with 2 marketing team members
  
Final interview with CEO
  
  

**Location:** Lund (preferred, as the majority of the team is based here)
  
  

**Report to:** CMO
  
  

We will begin reviewing resumes after the Christmas holidays, so you can expect a response and updates early next year.
  
  

Wishing you a Merry Christmas and a Happy New Year!
  
  

Conferences & social activities
  
  

Training & growth
  
  

Work/life balance
  
  

Freshly brewed coffee, fizzy drinks & snacks
  
  

Health & wellness
  
  

Building Lime together
  
  

About the company
  
  

At Lime, you find a listed company with 9 offices in 6 countries. Founded in 1990 we have been growing by approximately 20 % per year since 2000 – a pace we intend to keep. In 2020 we opened our first non-Nordic office in The Netherlands. Since then, we have entered Germany, and are continuously working on further expansion and acquisition strategies. But those are just facts and figures. The truly great thing about Lime is the people working here. We are a caring and high performing group of people who spread customer love. We go all in to create a world where every customer experience exceeds expectations, making customers’ lives easier through spot-on software and on-point expertise. Something that is still unique for a software company like Lime is that we own the entire product life cycle ourselves. We take care of software development, delivery, and support. We are responsible for keeping the chain intact and running smoothly. We call it #dontbreakthechain
  
  

Lime was founded by three students in Lund in 1990
  
  

Lime is climate compensating through a solar cell park in the south of Sweden
  
  

Lime has acquired six companies since 2017
  
  

Limes’ current CEO Nils started at Lime as one of the first trainees in 2006
  
  

Lime was introduced on the Nasdaq stock exchange in Stockholm in 2018
  
  

Lime launched its first Reversed Mentorship Program in 2019
  
  

Limes’ software reaches approximately 100 million people a day
  
  

Sara Pennsäter Åkesson | Contact Person
company_description: Looking for a boring employer? Look elsewhere! At Lime, we love customer care, sales and case management! We love to deliver that “something special” – while having a lot of fun along the way.

title: Senior Software Engineer - Älmhult
description:
***Capgemini is recruiting!***  

  

***Are you a developer? Cool! Because we are now looking for developers to our office in Älmhult (of course you can avail our in-hybrid work). At Capgemini Älmhult, you have the opportunity to be part of a small, close-knit team while also being integrated into a large international organization with approximately 340,000 employees worldwide. Here, you will get to work with leading technologies at prominent companies, while Capgemini Älmhult does everything to ensure your comfort at work***  

  

***YOUR ROLE***  

***If we haven't convinced you to apply yet, we hope this will get you across the finish line, a comprehensive, non-exhaustive list of benefits we offer, rather than listing numerous requirements.***  

  

* ***Opportunity to work with large & innovative clients on both a regional and global level***
* ***Opportunity for training and certification for those who want to be at the forefront***
* ***Certification bonus***
* ***A team that coaches, supports and is always there for a lovely coffee!***
* ***A team manager who supports you in your career development and makes sure you enjoy your job!***
* ***A flexible and hybrid work model***
* ***Tech communities***
* ***Mentoring program (as mentor or mentee)***
* ***Participation in Capgemini's various focus areas; Diversity and Inclusion, Sustainability, Wellness club, Art club etc.***
* ***Generous healthcare allowance, occupational pension, occupational healthcare, healthcare insurance and parental benefit***
* ***Fun and inspiring staff events***
  

***YOUR PROFILE***  

* ***+3 years of experience in any programming, preferably in Java, .NET or python***
* ***Experience working with cloud solutions such as Azure, AWS or Google Cloud***
* ***Good knowledge of design and architecture concepts***
* ***Know and have experience in agile and DevOps way of working***
* ***Good knowledge of database concepts***
* ***Ability to prototype new technical/business ideas, both individually and across teams (we love new ideas!)***
* ***Experience of Jira, Confluene or any other equivalent project management and documentation tool***
* ***Fluent English, so that you can communicate and collaborate with people across continents and cultures in an amazing way.***
* ***Good to have knowledge of Swedish language***
***WHAT WE BELIEVE YOU WILL ENJOY ABOUT WORKING HERE***

* ***We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.***
* ***At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.***
* ***Equip yourself with valuable certifications in the latest technologies such as AWS and Microsoft Azure.***

***At Capgemini, Practice DCX/C&CA (Digital Customer Experience/Cloud & Custom Application) in Sweden, we have thousands of highly skilled and dedicated consultants distributed across our offices in Sweden. We contribute in projects with expertise relating to Customer Experience and Cloud activities at the convergence of Transformational Consulting and System Integration. We partner with our clients to make the right connections across their entire enterprise spectrum so that they can create experiences that deliver rapid and sustainable value for their customers and their company. Together with innovative and sustainable technologies, we enhance, renew and make our most vital industries more efficient in their digital space.***  

  

***Our teams are working with different advanced technologies such as Mulesoft, Cloud, RPA, UX, .Net and Java. Our projects entail a holistic approach where we change the ways of working, thinking and acting. This makes us an organization that is constantly finding ourselves in a state of development together with our clients.***  

  

***APPLICATION***  

***We are continuously recruiting for this role, so please submit your application as soon as possible. From the time we contact you, the process takes approximately 3 weeks as we work as agile as possible in the recruitment process, which means that several steps can occur in parallel.***  

***#LI-ET1***

***ABOUT CAPGEMINI***  

***Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.***  

  

***Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com***  

***#LI-ET1***
company_description: Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology.

title: Processledare Statens Servicecenter
description:
På Migrationsverket är vi cirka 6 000 personer som arbetar med en av vår tids stora samhällsfrågor och med uppgifter som rör människors liv och framtid. Vårt jobb är viktigt på riktigt!


Hos oss får du arbeta med aktuella samhällsfrågor som påverkas av vad som händer i vår omvärld. Frågor som berör och engagerar. Vi erbjuder en dynamisk miljö som präglas av mötet med människor och ett kontinuerligt lärande.


Vi söker nu en **Processledare** till Processområde Tillstånd, specifikt process som berör Statens Servicecenter.


Som anställd på Migrationsverket får du möjlighet att påverka och förändra. Vi erbjuder dig en bra balans mellan arbete och fritid och goda möjligheter till distansarbete. Andra förmåner vi erbjuder vid anställning är exempelvis friskvårdsbidrag och friskvårdstimme samt ersättning upp till 90 % av lönen vid föräldraledighet.

**Vad gör en processledare?**


Processområde Tillstånds huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter är att arbeta löpande med utveckling och förvaltning av processerna på den verksamhetsnära sidan. På enheten arbetar processledare, verksamhetsexperter, förvaltningsledare, kravanalytiker och UX-designers. Enhetens uppdrag är bl.a. att utveckla och förvalta processerna Arbeta i Sverige, Studera i Sverige, Flytta till någon i Sverige, Återkalla, Service samt Studera i Sverige.


I din roll kommer du att arbeta med att upprätta och uppdatera styrdokument och handboksarbete mm. Du kommer också delta i kvalitetssäkring och kvalitetsuppföljningsarbete samt formulera remissvar både externt och internt. Vidare kommer du arbeta med att ta fram underlag för beredningar för avdelningens olika beslutsnivåer. Det ingår också i din roll att sprida information till externa aktörer såsom organisationer och myndigheter och delta i forum där dessa är representerade. Utöver detta kommer du också besvara frågor och skrivelser från externa aktörer och andra myndigheter liksom vår uppdragsgivare.


En annan viktig del i rollen är att utveckla ett nära samarbete med övriga verksamhetsexperter, samtliga processägare, processledare, rättsliga experter och operativa verksamheten. I huvudsak kommer du att arbeta inom återkallelseprocessen, men du kommer även stödja och stundtals arbeta i andra delprocesser.

**Vem är du?**  

Du är en god representant för Migrationsverket. Du planerar, organiserar och prioriterar arbetet på ett effektivt sätt samt sätter upp och håller tidsramar. Vidare är du noggrann och väl medveten om mål och kvalitet och lägger stor vikt vid att du lever upp till dessa krav. Du har en analytisk förmåga och förmågan att på eget initiativ identifierar frågor som behöver utredas vidare. Arbetet kräver att du är prestigelös och har en god samarbetsförmåga. Med en hög initiativförmåga ser du vad som behöver göras och du tar dig an dina uppgifter på ett lösningsorienterat vis.


I vårt arbete som statstjänstemän ställs även höga krav på omdöme och en hög säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet.

**Vi söker dig som har:**

* en akademisk utbildning med juridisk-, samhällsvetenskaplig-, eller beteendevetenskaplig inriktning eller annan utbildning i kombination med förvärvad arbetslivserfarenhet som är relevant för befattningen
* praktisk erfarenhet av processledning och processmodulering
* praktisk erfarenhet av projektledning
* god kommunikativ förmåga och förmåga att uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska
* goda kunskaper i Officepaketet; Word, Excel och Power Point

**Det är meriterande om du har:**

* aktuell erfarenhet och god kännedom om Migrationsverkets uppdrag och verksamhet
* flerårig erfarenhet av ledning inom asyl- och tillståndsärenden
* tidigare ledning inom servicecenter inom myndighet
* utbildning inom processutveckling
* utbildning projektledning
* utbildning inom SPARX

**Upplysningar**  

Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning  

Arbetstider: kontorsarbetstider eller förtroendearbetstid enligt överenskommelse  

Placering: Göteborg
  

Tillträde: Så snart som möjligt eller enligt överenskommelse  

Anställningsförmåner: Läs om våra anställningsförmåner här.  

  

**Ansökan**  

Välkommen med dina ansökningshandlingar senast **250110 .** Vi tar emot din ansökan via vårt rekryteringssystem.


Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

  

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_ Om rekryteringsprocessen För oss är det viktigt att all kompetens på arbetsmarknaden tillvaratas. Vi välkomnar därför alla sökande och strävar efter en jämn könsfördelning och mångfald. Som statlig myndighet rekryterar vi efter förtjänst och skicklighet. På arbetsgivarverket.se kan du läsa mer om vad det innebär. Vi använder urvalsfrågor under ansökningen. Besvara dem så utförligt du kan eftersom dina svar har betydelse för om du är kvalificerad att gå vidare i rekryteringen eller inte. I vissa rekryteringar använder vi också tester för att bedöma hur väl din skicklighet stämmer överens med tjänsten du söker. Vid en eventuell intervju kan du även få svara på frågor kopplat till säkerhet. Vill du komma i kontakt med fackliga företrädare finns kontaktuppgifter till Saco-S, Seko och ST längst ned på sidan ”Lediga jobb och intresseanmälan” på migrationsverket.se: Alla lediga jobb på Migrationsverket just nu - Migrationsverket Om du har skyddade personuppgifter, eller annan information som du själv bedömer som skyddsvärd, ska du kontakta rekrytering@migrationsverket.se innan du gör din ansökan så berättar vi mer om våra säkerhetsrutiner. Här kan du läsa mer om hur Migrationsverket hanterar personuppgifter Migrationsverkets rekryteringar sker helt i vår egen eller upphandlade leverantörers regi. Vi ber därför om att inte få telefonsamtal och mejl från rekryteringsföretag och annonsförsäljare.


Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Göteborg | Län: Västra Götalands län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 3.3.1-2024-16883 | Kontakt: Annelie Kungsman-Persson 010-4856896, | Publicerat: 2024-12-13 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-01-10

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**Software: fuel for mobility**
-------------------------------

  

  

We bring bold digital visions to life. So we’re on the lookout for more curious and creative engineers who want to create change – one line of high-quality code at a time. Our transformation isn't for everyone, but if you're excited about solving the leading-edge technological challenges facing the auto industry, then let’s talk about your next move.

  


**Let's introduce ourselves**
-----------------------------



Our team, Communication Platform are a dynamic team at Volvo Cars, focused on revolutionising how we connect with our customers. Our primary channel is currently the Volvo Car App, but we're expanding to encompass a wider range of platforms like email, SMS, WhatsApp, web, and even our vehicles themselves. With a wealth of opportunities to develop innovative systems, we're poised for significant growth. Our team is primarily based in Stockholm.


**What you'll do**
------------------



As a Senior Engineer, you'll play a pivotal role in building microservices, primarily using REST APIs, to power our communications platform. You'll collaborate with a talented cross-functional team, including Android, iOS, Quality Assurance, Backend, Product, and UX experts.Key Responsibilities:  



* Rapid Development: Design, develop, and deploy prototypes and production-ready features at a rapid pace.
* Technical Expertise: Leverage your Java and Kotlin skills to build high-performance, scalable, and reliable applications. Knowledge of C# is a Plus
* Cloud Native Development: Work with cutting-edge technologies like Kubernetes, GitHub Actions, ArgoCD, and more.
* Data Integration: Interact with various data sources, including Kafka, Artemis, Redis, and PostgreSQL.
* Collaboration: Partner with cross-functional teams to define product requirements, design solutions, and ensure high-quality delivery.
* Continuous Improvement**:** Drive technical excellence, promote best practices, and contribute to a culture of innovation.
**What you'll bring**
---------------------


* Technical Proficiency: Strong foundation in Java and Kotlin, with experience in microservices architecture, REST APIs, and cloud-native technologies.
* Problem-Solving: A keen ability to analyze complex problems, identify innovative solutions, and implement them effectively.
* Collaboration: A team player who thrives in a collaborative environment and can effectively communicate with diverse stakeholders.
* Self-Motivation: A self-starter who can take ownership of tasks, work independently, and drive projects forward.
* Continuous Learning:A passion for technology and a commitment to staying up-to-date with industry trends.

  

**Location:** Stockholm


**Ready to Take the Next Step?**
--------------------------------

  

  

Please submit your application through our career page. Due to GDPR regulations, we’re unable to store or consider applications from other platforms. Make sure to submit your application in English.


Once your application is successfully submitted, you’ll receive a confirmation email. Applications are open until 29th of January 2025. We’re excited to get to know you!

  

  

**Volvo Cars – driving change together**

  

  

Volvo Cars’ success is the result of a collaborative, diverse and inclusive working environment. Today, we’re one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, so you can reach your fullest potential.


And it’s so exciting – we’re well on our way on our journey towards full electrification. We have five fully electric cars already on the market, and five more on the way. Our fully-electric and plug-in hybrid cars combined make up almost 50 per cent of our sales. So come and join us in shaping the future of mobility. There’s never been a more rewarding time to play your part in our inspiring and creative teams!
company_description: At Volvo Car Group, our vision is clear: "To be the world's most progressive and desired premium car brand".

Once your application is successfully submitted, you’ll receive a confirmation email. Applications are open until 30th of January 2025. We’re excited to get to know you!

  

  

**Volvo Cars – driving change together**

  

  

Volvo Cars’ success is the result of a collaborative, diverse and inclusive working environment. Today, we’re one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, so you can reach your fullest potential. And it’s so exciting – we’re well on our way on our journey towards full electrification. We have five fully electric cars already on the market, and five more on the way. Our fully-electric and plug-in hybrid cars combined make up almost 50 per cent of our sales. So come and join us in shaping the future of mobility. There’s never been a more rewarding time to play your part in our inspiring and creative teams!
company_description: At Volvo Car Group, our vision is clear: "To be the world's most progressive and desired premium car brand".

title: Senior Spelutvecklare med fokus på UI/UX
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.

 **Jobbeskrivning**  

Vi söker en spelutvecklare med fokus på UI/UX att arbeta med vårt nyligen annonserade spel, tillsammans med några av de mest talangfulla personerna inom spelindustrin.


Du kommer att ha utrymme för kreativitet samtidigt som du samarbetar med designers, andra ingenjörer, artister och experter inom användarupplevelse (UX) för att förbättra och utveckla nya funktioner till spelet.


Spelet är byggt i Unreal och använder C++, blueprints och ett skriptspråk som heter Angelscript.
  

Du kommer att få möjlighet att lära dig både Unreal och Angelscript under uppdraget, men meriterande om du har viss kunskap i dessa.

### **Exempel på ansvarsområden:**

* Implementera funktioner för användargränssnitt (UI) i Unreal Engine med en blandning av C++, Angelscript och Unreal Blueprints.
* Samarbeta med ett brett spektrum av talanger för att leverera en fantastisk användarupplevelse som både känns spännande och lätt att förstå.

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**

  

* Några års erfarenhet av att arbeta inom spelindustrin
* Goda kunskaper inom C++-utveckling
* Kunskaper i att använda Unreal Engine
* Professionella kommunikationsfärdigheter i engelska.
* Ett kreativt och nyfiket sinne.

  

**Sista ansökningdatum:** 20-12-2024  

  

**Om Deploja**  

Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.  

  

Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?  


Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.


En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.


Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.


Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.


Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?


Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.

  

Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.


Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?

 *Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.*

title: Design System Lead
description:
At Storytel, we believe that powerful stories add an extra dimension to life. Storytel is one of the world’s leading audiobook and ebook streaming services and we offer unlimited listening to consumers in 25 markets. Our vision is to make the world a more empathetic and creative place.


We are now looking for a Design System Lead to join the team!

**About the role**
------------------


As a Design System Lead, you will be the guardian of our component systems for web and apps. Ensuring it remains a reliable, up-to-date resource across the product design and tech team. You will collaborate closely with designers and developers to maintain, evolve, and advocate for the system's principles and components and their proper implementation.


A part of your time will be dedicated to directly supporting designers in their projects, providing swift consultation while translating their needs into the design system when needed. This ensures seamless integration and alignment, reducing friction and empowering the design team to focus on solving user problems creatively. Your work will directly impact the efficiency and quality of the user experience. The System Design Lead is pivotal in empowering the design team to focus on solving user problems creatively while ensuring alignment with the broader product vision.


By maintaining and evolving the design system, you will ensure:

* Faster and more efficient design processes and development process.
* Consistent and high-quality user experiences across products.
* Improved collaboration between design and development.
* Scalability for future products and features.

**About the team**
------------------


As a Design System Lead, you will be a key member of our talented product design team, working alongside user researchers and other designers. By collaborating with your team, you will support ongoing projects while simultaneously developing and refining our design system. Close collaboration with our front-end engineers will ensure a seamless transition from design to implementation.

**About you**
-------------


To excel in this role, you should possess a deep understanding of design principles and a keen eye for detail. You are passionate about staying up-to-date with the latest design trends, Figma updates, and accessibility standards. A strong knowledge of iOS and Android native specificities - or a solid grasp of engineering concepts - is beneficial. As a strong communicator, you areable to effectively advocate for the design system within the organization. You enjoy sharing your knowledge and educating others, fostering a culture of design excellence.


Your key skills are:

  

* Experience working with a native application and its components across different platforms.
* Deep understanding of UI/UX principles, native applications and OS guidelines visual design, accessibility standards, and interaction design.
* Advanced skills in Figma and knowledge of design-to-development workflows (e.g., using Storybook, Token Studio, Jira and Github).
* Strong ability to collaborate and communicate with designers, developers, and stakeholders to advocate for the design system.
* A holistic approach to problem-solving, ensuring solutions align with the design system and overall product goals and development process.
* A rigorous focus on maintaining consistency and quality throughout the design system with high attention to detail.

**What we offer**
-----------------


Storytel offers a friendly, entrepreneurial, and fast-moving work environment where new ideas and creativity are welcomed. We like doing things in new ways and questioning old methods. The Storytel culture is vital to us, characterized by being welcoming and helpful. We don't believe in hierarchy and micromanagement; we highly believe in giving responsibility and having people grow alongside it.


Our culture encourages self-leadership, innovation, and collaboration – our employees are passionate about high-quality content and stories. There is a strong emphasis on continuous development, learning through experimentation, and actively sharing feedback to constantly improve performance. Our approach to leadership is rooted in communication, trust, and genuine care, recognizing that innovation often stems from collective wisdom, enabling individuals to thrive and achieve collective success.


If you believe that Storytel is a place where you could thrive, submit your application and we will contact you within a couple of weeks.

title: AOSP Senior Software Engineer
description:
**The opportunity**


We're currently looking for an AOSP Senior Software Engineer. Someone with a passion for electric mobility, an interest in technology, and a desire to create the change we know is needed.


The Infotainment Software team is a part of Connected Experience group in R&D and consists of specialists with broad expertise in Android Automotive OS. Currently the team is focused on development of a high-end infotainment system for the latest model of Polestar, which is not yet on the market. We’re committed to fostering our professional development with continuous learning, mentorship, and access to advanced tools and technologies.


This position is located in Gothenburg, Sweden. We believe in a hybrid model when it comes to remote and onsite work, knowing that both in-person collaboration and individual time to focus are needed. What matters most is that people get the time, and support, to do what needs to be done. And to enjoy doing it, of course.

 **The responsibilities**


In this role, this candidate will be expected to develop and modify Android-based applications and services for automotive platforms. Working as a member of the Infotainment Software team, the candidate will be instrumental in working closely with our supplier to ensure smooth integration of components developed by them.


See below for a more thorough breakdown of the various tasks and areas you'll be responsible for:


* Design and implementation of new features tailored to automotive requirements.
* Identify and fix bugs in the applications, libraries, etc. ensuring reliability and stability.
* Develop unit tests to ensure code quality and reliability.
* Participate in code reviews to maintain high coding standards.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including integration team, UI/UX, and systems engineers, and external suppliers to deliver a high-performing and secure in-car experience.

  

**The ideal candidate**


In order to succeed in this role, and at Polestar in general, there are a few characteristics you'll need to have. Tenacity. Flexibility. Curiosity. The ability to take the initiative, to meet deadlines and requirements, and to abandon ideas when they're not feasible.


We are looking for an individual with strong communication and teamwork skills, capable of working cross-functionally with diverse teams to deliver complex, high-quality software. The ideal candidate is keen on innovations, forward-thinking, and values creativity, collaboration, and diverse perspectives. Flexibility in implementing new solutions is also essential, ensuring adaptability in a dynamic environment.


In addition, you'll need the following:


* Degree qualified in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or similar.
* Experience in AOSP development and Android internals.
* Proven experience in building or enhancing infotainment systems for automotive platforms.
* Proficiency in Java, Kotlin, C++, and familiarity with embedded systems development using low-level programming.
* Proficient in using development tools like Android Studio, Git, and GitHub.
* Familiar or having experience with Vehicle Hardware Abstraction Layer (VHAL).
* Familiar or having experience with Android Interface Definition Language (AIDL).
* Experience in working with signals related to Flexray, SomeIP, IPCP, etc.
* Hands-on experience in integrating Android apps and framework layer with platform; troubleshooting any miscommunication of interfaces and signals.


Polestar is an international company, with various backgrounds represented. English, therefore, is the language of written and spoken communication. And though we have a global presence, we maintain the growth-mindset. Change happens often at Polestar. But so does progress. Expect an accelerating, exciting environment.  



  

**The process**


If the above matches your ambitions, be sure to apply. Applications for this position will initially close on 10th January 2025.


The Polestar journey is an electric one.

title: Grafisk Designer
company_industry: Environmental Services, Engineering Services, and Industrial Machinery Manufacturing
description:

title: Content Creator
description:
**About the role:** 




 Are you our dynamic and creative content specialist who thrives on creativity and high-quality content? Our goal is to deliver compelling visuals and engaging stories that resonate with our audience. If you’re passionate about design, have a natural skill for video production such as Video Ads & Commercials, Social Media Videos and possess an eye for detail, we’d love to meet you!
 



  





**What You’ll Do:** 



* **Design:** 
 Create visually appealing graphics, layouts, and visual assets for digital and print platforms following our brand guidelines.
* **Video production:** 
 Edit, and produce quick videos that align with our brand and goals.
* **Content enhancement** 
 : Add creative flair to projects, ensuring they stand out while maintaining consistency with our visual identity.
* **Detail-oriented work** 
 : Review content thoroughly to ensure top-quality results.
* **Collaborate** 
 : Work closely with marketing and branding team members to conceptualize and execute projects that bring our ideas to life.



  





**What We’re Looking For:** 



* **Experience in design tools** 
 : Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (After Effects, Premiere Pro, Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign) or equivalent.
* **Aesthetic sense:** 
 A sharp eye for composition, color, and design trends to elevate our creative outputs.
* **Problem-solving mindset:** 
 Ability to adapt, iterate, and bring solutions to creative challenges.
* **Self-starter:** 
 You’re used to working in fast-paced environments. Extra points if you have startup experience!



  





**Nice to have Skills:** 



* Experience in motion graphics or animation.
* Photography skills
* Comfortable with filming equipment, lighting setups, and video editing tools.



  





**Why Join Us?** 



* **Make a big impact:** 
 Your creativity will directly shape how we tell stories, engage our audience, and elevate our brand on a global stage.
* **Entrepreneurial culture:** 
 Work in an environment that embraces bold ideas and encourages experimentation.
* **Collaborative environment:** 
 Work alongside a talented, passionate, and supportive team



  





**How to Apply:** 




 Send your resume, a link to your portfolio and a brief introduction via LinkedIn.
 



 This is a project-based position with potential opportunities for extension.

title: Product Designer(Bangkok-based)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more . Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

 We believe in making it easier for everyone to experience the world.
   

  

 Accessibility and design systems is the foundation of how we build and design at Agoda. As a champion for inclusion and our design system, you will play a role in shaping our design culture. By implementing best practices and guidelines, you will help our design organization to create products that are not only innovative but also accessible to all users.
   

  

 As a Product Designer, you will be joining a team that’s responsible for the core foundation of design, Agoda design systems, and Design Operations. We’re passionate about inclusion, systematic design, organization, and building the most scalable solutions for our partners and stakeholders. We’re a large, diverse team and look forward to a new strong team player.
   

  

**What’s product design like at Agoda?**
 Typically, product designers at Agoda work alongside a product manager, web and app engineers, and cross-functional partners. Together they drive their own part of Agoda, deliver solutions to problems and get feedback directly from customers and internal partners.
   

  

****Day to day, it looks like:****
* Advocate for inclusion, equity, and accessibility
* Have a deep understanding of our Agoda Design System
* Support accessibility learning and onboarding for designers
* Promote and implement inclusive design best practices, guidelines, and principles within the design organization and systems
* Utilize your expertise in visual design, user experience, and design systems to create inclusive solutions with product design partners
* Provide feedback and critique on accessibility and inclusion through the design review and design review handoff process
* Partner with product designers to help define roadmap and priorities for creating accessible digital products
* Review accessibility compliance of components and patterns within ADS
* Provide UX / UI support for internal design tooling


**Product Designer** 
 at Agoda means you have a track record of:
   

  

* Strong foundation with Figma design tool
* 1 – 3 years of experience working with or on design systems
* Experience with design-lead user research
* A portfolio of work relating to design systems or a strong comprehension of how they work
* Solid understanding and knowledge of design fundamentals. (ie Gestalt, Color, Typography, Grids, etc)
* An understanding of interaction, visual, and user experience design
* Able to articulate and explain your ideas to other designers, engineers, product managers, and other stakeholders
* A strong growth mindset and team-player attitude
* Care deeply about organization, file structure, and the details
* Work with Designers, Agoda Design Systems, and IT as our primary stakeholder
* Help shape the design culture at Agoda that will ultimately impact the experience our customers have with our products and services


****Qualities we value in designers:****
* Effective articulation of ideas and design solutions
* Expressing feedback with kindness and candor
* Tolerance for ambiguity and healthy curiosity
* Translation of quantitative & qualitative insights into design decisions
* Contribution to our culture: motivation, optimism, quality, integrity


 #seattle #sanfrancisco #beijing #newyork #london #bangkok #singapore #chicago #hongkong #singapore #berlin #shanghai #losangeles #boston #austin #toronto #luxembourg #munich #oslo #copenhagen #stockholm #helsinki #brussels #hamburg #stuttgart #taipei #hamburg #stuttgart #dublin #telaviv #sydney #melbourne #perth #vancouver #montreal #prague #paris #dublin #telaviv #milan #rome #tokyo #osaka #amsterdam #moscow #saintpetersburg #frankfurt #shenzhen #istanbul #dubai #kiev #seoul
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.
   

  

 We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .
   

  

 To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

title: UX/UI designer with coding skills!
description:
**What We Are Looking For & Our Journey Ahead**
 A UX/UI designer that isn't afraid to code! You want to help us on our journey to become the most user-friendly and intuitive CRM system in Europe! Lime is the market leader in the Nordics within CRM. Lime Go is a scaleup entity within Lime Group, combining speed with resources.
   

  

**What does this mean for you?**
* The first designer in the Go Team working closely with our PM and the Engineering Team
* UX/UI resources in-house (3 people working with our other product Lime CRM)
* We will have the flexibility and speed of a scaleup
* A lot of freedom and you can shape the product we build


**The team today and our method**
 We are a small, ambitious, and autonomous development team with a lot of freedom. We guarantee no code monkey business with the possibility to have a significant impact on what we develop and how we develop the product.
   

  

 Aside from the dev team, we have a fully operational sales, support, customer success & marketing organization distributing our product to new users every day .
   

  

 At Lime (like all other development companies) we work with a development process. We will not go into details in this ad, but if you are curious, do not hesitate to ask! The important part is that since we are a small team you will own what we develop and how it looks!
   

  

**Your tasks being a part of our team**
 As a Designer in the Lime Go team, you will be working on improving the UX/UI, listening closely to the users' wants and needs to determine the highest value features and workflows. Lime Go contains a lot of data, has a wide variety of customers, and supports high customizability, making it a fun, challenging and awesome product to work with. This is an objective truth.
   

  

**Skills & Requirements**
**The tech-stack**
 We have recently finished a 1,5-year FE redesign project which means you will deep dive into a completely rewritten, well-organized, and clean codebase. See pictures below to compare!
   

  

 The frontend is written with the latest versions of React and Redux with a high focus on UX/UI. Therefore, we value your skills as follows:
   

  

**Must have:**
* Javascript
* React (with hooks!)
* Design/UX/UI skills and Figma


**Nice to have:** 
 Redux or previous .NET experience
   

  

**Where?**
 The dev team is fully remote but some of us are working from our Stockholm.
   

  

**Who are we and why Lime Go?**
 Your code will affect thousands of businesses and it will help them save time through smart processes, automation and enable them to become a more efficient sales organization.
   

  

 We also have generous employee benefits such as company conferences and parties, team trips, six weeks of vacation, pension, monthly pubs, Lime Go merch (coming soon), wellness allowance etc.
   

  

 During the ride, we will have a good laugh and do a bunch of team activities. Apply now to join our journey, Europe awaits!
   

  

**The process, step by step**
 We do not have a deadline for this recruitment, but as we process applications continuously, why wait? No time like the presence. Apply now!
   

  

* First off, you will get on a screening call with a person on the team. You might also meet one or multiple members of the team.
* Then you will have an interview.
* Get a technical assignment to show off your skills.
* After that, you will have an in-depth interview.
* Finally, you get to meet our CEO (Nils) / Go Director (Max) for the final interview.


 If possible, we want to combine some of the steps above into one batch, so you will become a Limer as fast as you want!
   

  

 See you soon :)
   

  

**Let’s GO!**

title: Graphic / Motion Designer (Hybrid)
description:

 Shore is a creative production agency helping growing brands seamlessly scale their creative team by offering a more powerful alternative to hiring freelancers, in-house teams or traditional agency retainers.
