title: Platform Engineer (Databricks)
description:
**Job ID:** R0010133


**Date posted:** 13/12/2024


**Company description**  

We are on the journey to transform our digital capabilities, bringing core business processes, people, data & technology together - an enabler for IKEA to become an even better home furnishing retailer in the future. A journey that needs passionate people who embrace change, dare to question and want to make a difference. If that sounds like you, come and join us. Together we can do great things!


About the area


Inter IKEA Group is organized in three core businesses - Range, Supply and Retail Concept - and five enabling functions. Together we contribute to the success of IKEA and share responsibility for the franchise offer.


The enabling functions lead key common activities in networks across Inter IKEA Group, as well as cover specific needs for the core businesses. The five Enabling functions are Operations Management, Business Performance & Support, Communication, Sustainability and People & Culture.


Operations Management leads and holds together the development and maintenance of a common foundation for how we work together across the value chain, our operating model. We enable strategic movements towards the IKEA goals through the strategic landscape and work closely with all parts of the value chain to achieve them. It includes teams for business insights, capability and process development, strategy and roadmap, data and product, and technology.


We have chosen to organize our work in a data and product paradigm where we are building empowered teams that have the privilege to take responsibility while being supported by servant leaders.

 **Job description**  

Join our dynamic Data and Analytics team as a Platform Engineer with a focus on Databricks platform development and operations. In this critical role, you will design, develop, manage, and operate high-quality shared platforms that support efficient operations across IKEA's value chain. Utilizing both new and existing technologies and delivery methods, you will help drive our digital agenda, ensuring IKEA remains at the forefront of a rapidly evolving environment.


Assignment


As a Platform Engineer, your key responsibilities will include:

* Designing, developing, running, and lifecycle managing high-quality platforms that enable products and services, using the appropriate tools, methods, and frameworks.
* Creating platform designs that adhere to best practices and standards in architecture, security, performance, and reliability to meet requirements and compliance.
* Collaborating within agile/DevOps teams to manage the development and lifecycle of platforms and services, ensuring effective communication with stakeholders.
* Implementing and promoting good platform engineering practices to improve time to market and meet business needs.
* Driving change activities across different environments to ensure platform functionality and availability.
* Delivering tests, performance analysis, configuration management, and creating functional/feature specifications to enhance platform, product, and service delivery.
* Continuously exploring and evaluating new technologies to enhance innovation and productivity.
* Providing support and guidance to consumers, promoting best practices and collaboration.
* Enabling a data-driven culture at IKEA by transitioning from legacy analytics to modern technology platforms.

  

**Qualification**  

About you


You are a passionate Platform Engineer with substantial experience working on the Databricks platform. You have a strong background in data platforms or enterprise solutions and a keen understanding of data democratization. Your expertise includes working as a platform and/or software engineer in complex cloud-based analytic solutions, particularly with Azure tools.


You are:

* Driven by responsibility and ownership of outcomes.
* Organized and thrive in both structured and dynamic environments.
* Excelling in global, complex settings and adept at simplifying and prioritizing to support strategic and operational goals.
* Energized by IKEA's core values and committed to continuous improvement.


To be successful in this role, the following knowledge, skills and experiences would be valuable:

* Strong understanding of platform engineering principles.
* Broad experience with industry-standard platform engineering practices.
* Proficiency in design and architecture concepts.
* Motivated to continuously enhance design skills and remain updated on modern tools and technologies.
* Ability to lead by example, fostering simplicity, efficiency, ownership, and accountability.
* Enthusiastic about acquiring new knowledge and championing new methods and processes to improve performance.
* Flexible and adaptable to new ideas, approaches, and strategies.
* Excellent collaboration skills with team members, stakeholders, and suppliers (including virtual collaboration).
* Proficient in clearly communicating technical concepts and processes at appropriate levels.
* Understanding of IKEA's business complexity and the integrated role of technology.
* Familiarity with IKEA’s corporate identity, core values, and vision.
* Experience working in agile/iterative software development teams with a DevOps setup.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.


Qualifications

* Formal qualifications in computer science, platform engineering, or any engineering equivalent
* Minimum 5 years of professional experience within platform engineering with at least 3 years of experience as a platform engineer, specifically with the Databricks platform.
* Experience of working in agile/iterative platform development teams with a DevOps working set-up and with an emphasis on self-organisation and delivery to agreed commitments

 **More Information** ***Please note that due to the upcoming holiday season in December, our recruitment process may take a bit longer than usual. We will do our best to keep all candidates updated on their status before any breaks. Thank you for your patience during this time!***


This is a full-time role (40 hours per week) and based in Malmö, Sweden. This role sits in Data & Analytics, Data & Product, Operations Management, and reports to Data Operations Manager, Markus Lentinen.


12th of January is the closing date to apply for this role.


If you have questions about the recruitment process, please connect with Jas.garcha@inter.ikea.com


Please send your application – CV – in English and tell us why you would be a good fit. We look forward to hearing from you!


At IKEA, we are looking for people who believe everyone deserves a seat at the table. You’re welcome no matter where you come from, what you believe, and what you look like. We don’t even care how you have furnished your home. We’re interested in you simply because you’re you. Even if your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. We believe that people’s different perspectives, backgrounds, and personalities make us better at understanding our customers dreams and needs. At IKEA, we’re all on the same project.  

  

If you have a special need that requires accommodation in the recruitment process, just let us know.
company_description: At IKEA, we share an inspiring vision: “to create a better everyday life for the many people”.

title: Platform Leader (Databricks)
description:
**Job ID:** R0010123


**Date posted:** 13/12/2024


**Company description**  

We are on the journey to transform our digital capabilities, bringing core business processes, people, data & technology together - an enabler for IKEA to become an even better home furnishing retailer in the future. A journey that needs passionate people who embrace change, dare to question and want to make a difference. If that sounds like you, come and join us. Together we can do great things!

**About the area**


Inter IKEA Group is organized in three core businesses - Range, Supply and Retail Concept - and five enabling functions. Together we contribute to the success of IKEA and share responsibility for the franchise offer.


The enabling functions lead key common activities in networks across Inter IKEA Group, as well as cover specific needs for the core businesses. The five Enabling functions are Operations Management, Business Performance & Support, Communication, Sustainability and People & Culture.


Operations Management leads and holds together the development and maintenance of a common foundation for how we work together across the value chain, our operating model. We enable strategic movements towards the IKEA goals through the strategic landscape and work closely with all parts of the value chain to achieve them. It includes teams for business insights, capability and process development, strategy and roadmap, data and product, and technology.


We have chosen to organize our work in a data and product paradigm where we are building empowered teams that have the privilege to take responsibility while being supported by servant leaders.

 **Job description**  

We are seeking an experienced digital platform leader to join our team at IKEA. In this role, you will lead the development and operations of a platform that enables our products to talk to each other in a standard way. As a key representative of our developer and product community, you will ensure the efficiency, security, and shared capabilities of our platform. Your expertise in Databricks platform development and operations will be essential in achieving these goals.


Assignment

* Platform Vision and Roadmap: Set the platform vision with a clear roadmap, ensuring alignment with our digital product roadmap ambitions.
* Development and Operations Oversight: Oversee the development, implementation, and maintenance of the platform, ensuring smooth day-to-day operations.
* Platform Backlog Management: Accountable for building, editing, and maintaining the platform backlog, and clearly communicating it to products and stakeholders.
* Platform Prioritization and Compliance: Prioritize platform needs based on various product requirements and release schedules while complying with relevant frameworks and standards.
* Team Composition and Operation: Manage the digital platform team’s composition and operational functioning.
* Release Planning and Stakeholder Engagement: Develop and communicate digital platform release plans, manage expectations for feature delivery, and engage key stakeholders, including developers and suppliers.
* Efficiency and Budget Management: Ensure the platform is efficient and user-friendly for products and developers, control costs, and provide input to the overall budget.
* Dependency and Blocker Management: Identify dependencies and blockers, improving delivery capabilities.
* User Insights: Gather insights to understand and empathize with the products and developers, creating measures of success to track platform outcomes.

 **Qualification**  

About you

* You have a minimum of 5 years of progressive and diverse experience in digital product or platform development, with demonstrable experience in Databricks platform development and operations.
* You bring extensive knowledge of current and emerging technology landscapes, particularly in digital platforms and how they add value for developers.
* You are enthusiastic about working in a rapidly changing environment and passionate about creating innovations in the digital landscape.
* You have a strong entrepreneurial drive, always striving to develop better digital solutions.
* You possess strong communication and collaboration skills, able to build trustful relationships with business and technical stakeholders.
* You are motivated by leading a digital product across dependencies and contribute significantly to the success of IKEA.


To be successful in this role, the following knowledge, skills and experiences would be valuable:

* Technical Expertise: Extensive experience with Databricks platform development and operations.
* Data-Driven Decision Making: Ability to bring a data-driven approach to both day-to-day management and strategic decision making.
* Agile and DevOps Experience: Familiarity with Agile principles and experience working in an Agile or DevOps setup.
* Problem-Solving Skills: Ability to handle complexity and solve problems with simplicity.
* Leadership and Team Management: Proven capability to lead, inspire, and empower team members, delivering results with speed and agility.
* Stakeholder Management: Strong ability to communicate and engage with key stakeholders, including developers and suppliers.
* Analytical Skills: Proven analytical skills and experience making decisions based on both hard and soft data.
* Collaborative Mindset: Excellent team working, leading, and collaborative skills.


Qualifications

* Minimum of 5 years of progressive and diverse experience in digital product or platform development
* Demonstrable experience in working in an Agile or DevOps working set-up
* Strong knowledge of the data engineer’s and developer’s day to day challenges

  

**More Information** ***Please note that due to the upcoming holiday season in December, our recruitment process may take a bit longer than usual. We will do our best to keep all candidates updated on their status before any breaks. Thank you for your patience during this time!***


This is a full-time role (40 hours per week) and based in Malmö, Sweden. This role sits in Data & Analytics, Data & Product, Operations Management, and reports to Data Operations Manager, Markus Lentinen.


12th of January 2025 is the closing date to apply for this role.


If you have questions about the recruitment process, please connect with Jas.garcha@inter.ikea.com


Please send your application – CV – in English and tell us why you would be a good fit. We look forward to hearing from you!


At IKEA, we are looking for people who believe everyone deserves a seat at the table. You’re welcome no matter where you come from, what you believe, and what you look like. We don’t even care how you have furnished your home. We’re interested in you simply because you’re you. Even if your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. We believe that people’s different perspectives, backgrounds, and personalities make us better at understanding our customers dreams and needs. At IKEA, we’re all on the same project.  

  

If you have a special need that requires accommodation in the recruitment process, just let us know.

title: Data Engineering Leader
description:
**Job ID:** R0010132


**Date posted:** 13/12/2024


**Company description**  

We are on the journey to transform our digital capabilities, bringing core business processes, people, data & technology together - an enabler for IKEA to become an even better home furnishing retailer in the future. A journey that needs passionate people who embrace change, dare to question and want to make a difference. If that sounds like you, come and join us. Together we can do great things!

**About the area**


Inter IKEA Group is organized in three core businesses - Range, Supply and Retail Concept - and five enabling functions. Together we contribute to the success of IKEA and share responsibility for the franchise offer.


The enabling functions lead key common activities in networks across Inter IKEA Group, as well as cover specific needs for the core businesses. The five Enabling functions are Operations Management, Business Performance & Support, Communication, Sustainability and People & Culture.


Operations Management leads and holds together the development and maintenance of a common foundation for how we work together across the value chain, our operating model. We enable strategic movements towards the IKEA goals through the strategic landscape and work closely with all parts of the value chain to achieve them. It includes teams for business insights, capability and process development, strategy and roadmap, data and product, and technology.


We have chosen to organize our work in a data and product paradigm where we are building empowered teams that have the privilege to take responsibility while being supported by servant leaders.

 **Job description**  

As a Data Engineering Leader at IKEA, you will drive and shape the future of our data capabilities. Your primary role will be to design and develop data products and enhance data platforms while leading a cross-functional team of data engineers. You will be an instrumental figure in advising business functions to maximize value from data, ensuring that insights and conclusions are readily available and easily accessible across the organization.


Assignment

* Drive continuous improvement, collaboration, and knowledge sharing of methodologies, tools, and materials across the IKEA Data Engineering community.
* Provide technical leadership for Data Engineers across the organization, fostering a culture of support and collaboration within the team and the Data & Analytics organisation.
* Collaborate with various parts of the organization to understand stakeholder needs and develop viable solutions.
* Support the establishment of data assets and lifecycle processes to maximize connected value.
* Ensure consistency by sharing relevant development techniques, digital frameworks, and best practices.
* Facilitate easy access to data engineering insights and conclusions for other parts of the organization.
* Support a culture of data-driven decision making across IKEA organizations.
* Work closely with data engineers, data scientists, platform leaders, platform engineers, architects, analysts, peers, and other relevant roles across IKEA as well as within your team.
* Stay up to date with the latest technology trends.
* Assure quality and contribute to the testing of deliverables.

  

**Qualification** **About you**


You are an experienced and motivated data engineering professional with a background in leadership and business development within complex organizations. You have the drive to innovate with data and technology to simplify and enhance efficiency at IKEA. You enjoy building relationships and networks, have a growth mindset, and are passionate about transforming data into actionable business insights.


To be successful in this role, the following knowledge, skills and experiences would be valuable:


Knowledge:

* Leadership and business development experience from complex organisations.
* Understanding of various data structures and common methods in data transformation.
* Proficiency with an appropriate set of languages, technologies, and frameworks, particularly Databricks or Apache Spark, and cloud environments.
* Experience with modern development techniques such as Agile and DevOps.
* Expertise in designing data pipelines, data warehousing, data modelling, and database design.
* Deep domain knowledge within one or more areas like supply chain, finance, manufacturing, procurement etc.


Motivation:

* Eager to understand business needs, take initiative and driven to achieve results with people.
* Enjoy developing IKEA through innovation and by building relationships and networks.
* Have a growth mindset: curious to explore, eager to learn, and finding better ways, as well as energized by sharing.
* Inspired by the possibilities and opportunities digital and information technology bring to enable, transform, and break new grounds.
* Commitment to the users and customers with energy to champion their needs.


Capabilities:

* Ability to balance multiple stakeholders and agendas simultaneously.
* Capacity to naturally and effectively communicate, collaborate, network, and build relationships across a complex organization.
* Ability to explain the benefits of data engineering and data products to both non-technical and technical stakeholders.
* Proficient in using technology as a business tool and translating requirements into solutions, balancing user experience, business needs, and IT constraints.
* Good analytical skills combined with being structured and organized.
* Excellent interpersonal communication skills: active listening, coaching, and facilitating.

**Qualifications**

* Master's degree or similar/higher qualifications in engineering, mathematics, computer science, information systems or equivalent experience.
* Experience as a project member in agile project environments and methodologies as well in running business activities.
* Preferred, Minimum of 3 years in a similar senior role, with at least 10 years of relevant experience or equivalent skills and knowledge

  

**More Information** ***Please note that due to the upcoming holiday season in December, our recruitment process may take a bit longer than usual. We will do our best to keep all candidates updated on their status before any breaks. Thank you for your patience during this time!***

title: Software DevOps Engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*  

  

**Job Description**  

Development and maintenance of systems for CI/CD for both cloud services and embedded software. Also includes development of systems for deployment of embedded software in manufacturing.  

  

**Your Profile (Must-have requirements)**  

* Proven experience in cloud environments and proficiency with CI/CD tools such as Jenkins, Git, and preferably Gerrit. Strong general Linux skills.

  

**Application deadline:** 22-12-2024  

  

**About Us**  

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.  

  

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?  

  

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!  

  



**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.


A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.


Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.


Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.


Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?


Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.


Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.


Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
### **General Information**

**Locations**: Stockholm, Stockholm County, Sweden
  

Role ID
207283
Worker Type
Regular Employee
Studio/Department
CTO - Studio Technology Group
Flexible Work Arrangement
On Site
### **Description & Requirements**

We are a global team of creators, storytellers, technologists, experience originators, innovators and so much more. We believe amazing games and experiences start with teams as diverse as the players and communities we serve. At Electronic Arts, the only limit is your imagination.
**We are EA**


For more than fifteen years we've entertained millions of players around the world with our award-winning games. Our teams have expressed their passion for outstanding game feel, audio-visual quality and technical innovation in the Need for Speed, Battlefield and Star Wars Battlefront franchises.

**The Challenge Ahead**


We are DRE (Development & Release Engineering) - a central EA team at the intersection of DevOps, Release Management and Build Engineering. We build, manage and maintain the build pipelines for the majority of EA’s studios worldwide. We are looking for an engineer to work with our DRE Cobra team that is based in Europe and in North America. You'll work with developing and evolving the Continuous Integration and Deployment systems for the games being developed at EA, and provide support for these services. You will report to a Technical Director.

**Responsibilities**


You will be responsible for the developing and supporting our build platform, tools, and services that automate game processes, transforming source code and assets into playable games. You’ll work closely with our customers (game teams) to ensure we provide services to help improving their software quality and productivity.

**Requirements**

* 3+ years of experience in the game industry, as a tools or build engineer.
* Proficiency in Azure (DevOps, compute, and storage services).
* Solid programming skills (we use Python).
* Experience in Groovy, Jenkins JobDSL, and Jenkins Pipeline or similar CI system
* 3+ years of experience in Infrastructure-as-Code (We use Terraform).
* Follow good software development practices, including code reviews and unit testing.
* Familiarity with containerization and virtualization technologies (Docker, vSphere, and Kubernetes).
* Familiarity with Source Control concepts: Git, Perforce or similar tools.
* Familiarity with Gitlab or similar platforms.

title: Business Systems Architect
description:
**Fantastic challenges. Amazing opportunities.**

  


GKN Aerospace is reimagining air travel: going further, faster and greener! Fuelled by great people whose expertise and creativity sets the standards in our industry, we’re inspired by the opportunities to innovate and break boundaries. We’re proud to play a part in protecting the world’s democracies. And we’re committed to putting sustainability at the centre of everything we do, opening up and protecting our planet. With over 16,000 employees across 33 manufacturing sites in 12 countries we serve over 90% of the world’s aircraft and engine manufacturers and achieved sales of £3.35 bn.in 2023. There are no limits to where you can take your career.


**About the opportunity**
-------------------------



Join our IT Center of Excellence PLM team at GKN Aerospace Engines Trollhättan, where we are dedicated to pushing the boundaries of technology and engineering. We are looking for a PLM Solution Architect to drive and enrich our Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) landscape and initiatives.

  

  

The PLM Center of Excellence forms part of the wider Engineering IT team, an integral part of the Engines Digital Office.


**Job description**
-------------------



As a PLM Solution Architect, you will design, develop, and implement solutions in our global PLM environment based on Siemens PLM. You will utilize frameworks such as BMIDE, Teamcenter Services, ITK, and NX Open to configure and extend PLM functionalities. Applying test-driven development practices, you will ensure high-quality software delivery. Your role will involve developing software in C# (.net), C, C++, and PowerShell to support the PLM platform. Additionally, you will manage and optimize CI/CD (Azure DevOps) pipelines, configuration management, and Git repositories. Automating testing and deployment processes will be key to enhancing efficiency and reliability.


**Qualifications**
------------------



To be successful in this role, you should have proven experience as a PLM Solution Architect with expertise in Teamcenter and NX. Strong knowledge in BMIDE, Teamcenter configuration, Teamcenter Services, ITK, and NX Open frameworks is essential. You should be proficient in test-driven development and software development in C#, C, C++ and PowerShell. Experience with Azure DevOps, configuration management, and Git is required. Skills and interest in automation testing and deployment automation is key. A solid understanding of general IT concepts, including network, database, and server management is desirable.

  


**Why Join Us**

  

  

* Innovative Environment: Be part of a forward-thinking company that values innovation and continuous improvement.
* Collaborative Culture: Enjoy a collaborative and inclusive work culture where your ideas are valued.
* Professional Growth: Opportunities for continuous learning and professional development.
* Supportive Team: Work alongside a senior Solution Architect and a team that supports each other to achieve excellence.
  


**Personal Traits We Value**

  

  

* Proactive Problem Solver: You take initiative and are always looking for ways to improve processes and solutions.
* Team Player: You thrive in a collaborative environment and enjoy working with others to achieve common goals.
* System Thinker: You focus on sustainable, long-term solutions by understanding how each detail fits into the bigger picture.
* Adaptable: You are flexible and can adapt to changing priorities and new challenges.
* Passionate: You are passionate about technology and continuously seek to expand your knowledge and skills.
  


We are looking for people who want to make a difference, talented members with the skills and passions to become the best of the future in what they do.


The selection process takes place continuosly. The position may therefore be filled before the application deadline. Therefore, do not wait with your application!


In order for our recruitment process to take place in a structured and qualitative manner, we only accept applications through our recruitment tool Careers.

  


Employment type: Permanent  

Last application date: 2025-01-31

  


*The position requires that you undergo and be approved according to the current regulations for security protection. For positions where GKN's customer has requirements for security classification, this may, in some cases, involve specific citizenship requirements.*  



We’ll offer you fantastic challenges and amazing opportunities. This is your chance to be part of an organisation that has proven itself to be at the cutting edge of our industry; and is committed to pushing the boundaries even further. And with some of the best training on offer in the industry, who knows how far you can go?

  


**A Great Place to work needs a Great Way of Working**

  


Everyone is welcome to apply to GKN. We believe that we can only achieve our ambitions through a coming together of diverse minds who enjoy collaborating in an inspirational environment. Through our commitment to diversity, inclusion and belonging and by living our five powerful principles we’ve created a culture where everyone feels welcome to contribute. It’s a culture that won us ‘The Best Workplace Culture Award’. By embracing and celebrating what makes us unique we encourage everyone to bring their full self to work.


We’re also committed to providing an accessible recruitment process, so if you require reasonable adjustments at any stage during our recruitment process please get in touch and let us know.


We are the place where human dreams, plus human endeavour, shape the future of aerospace innovation and technology.

title: Testautomatiseringsingengör - Tietoevry Tech Services (m/f/d)
description:
You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.
Har du en bred teknisk bakgrund, passion för problemlösning och vill ansluta dig till ett av Nordens största Tech-företag? Vi söker en Test automation specialist som vill bli en del av Tietoevry Tech Services. Tietoevry Tech Services driver företagsomfattande transformationer av kundernas affärsprocesser, applikationer och infrastruktur.  

Vårt testteam fortsätter att växa och nu söker vi fler specialister inom test och kvalitetssäkring för spännande konsultuppdrag. Har du stort intresse för testautomatisering, gillar konsultrollen och omväxling samt tycker det är kul att vara en del av ett team där vi aktivt delar med oss av kunskaper inom våra kompetensområden? Bli en av oss!
När du börjar på Tietoevry Tech Services som testautomatiseringsingengör kommer du:* Att arbeta huvudsakligen självständigt men inom ett testteam med att designa och underhålla automatiserade tester, skapa testskript, exekvera och rapportera resultatet.
* Vårt team arbetar med kvalitetssäkring i alla typer av branscher. Vi har bland annat kunder inom finansbranschen, offentlig sektor, detaljhandeln och tillverkningssektorn. Som konsult hos oss kommer du växla mellan att sitta ute hos kund och arbeta i deras interna projekt och att ingå i någon av våra helhetsåtaganden där leveransteamen ofta jobbar inom agila metoder och DevOps med automatiserade testprocesser.
* Uppdragens omfattning varierar och kan vara både nyutvecklingsprojekt och övergångsprojekt. Oavsett ditt uppdrag kommer du alltid att vara en del av Tietoevrys testcommunity, som består av mer än 1000 kvalitetssäkringspersonal över hela världen.


Vem vi söker:* Du är svensk medborgare och pratar flytande svenska samt engelska
* Du har några års arbetslivserfarenhet inom testautomationsområdet och kunskap av olika testautomatiserings ramverk och testautomatiseringsprocesser
* Kunskap och erfarenheter av testautomatisering inom Agilt och DevOps-miljöer
* Kunskap inom ett eller flera av följande verktyg och områden: *Robot Framework, Java/Selenium, UFT, Playwright* *eller liknande*


Eftersom du kommer att jobba nära våra kunder i konsultuppdrag så tror vi att du är en social, och analytisk person som gillar att arbeta i en roll där tempot är högt och där arbetsuppgifterna snabbt kan förändras. Vi tror också att du har god kommunikationsförmåga, uppskattar att arbeta i team och att du gärna delar med dig av dina kunskaper samtidigt som du också kan arbeta självständigt och fokuserat när så krävs.
Det är meriterande om du också har:* Certifiering (ISTQB Foundation level eller högre/liknande)
* Kunskaper inom Continuous Integration Testing
* Tidigare arbetat inom telecom, finansiella sektorn, säkerhetsbranschen eller offentlig sektor
* Kunskaper i programmeringsspråk, exempelvis *Phyton, Java, .NET*


Vi erbjuder  

Vi erbjuder dig professionell tillväxt, meningsfulla projekt, öppen kultur och en enastående balans mellan arbete och privatliv! Vi erbjuder dig en möjlighet att skapa framtiden för en snabbt växande och viktig sektor. Vi tror att vår organisationskultur är en viktig del för att du ska bli framgångsrik. Vi tillhandahåller en flexibel hybrid arbetsmodell som en del av vår kultur och vårt sätt att arbeta. Slutligen tror vi också på nyfikenhet och konstant lärande som en livsstil där du behöver skola om dig varje dag när nya möjligheter dyker upp.  

Fick vi dig inspirererad?  

Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!  

Bifoga ditt CV eller LinkedIn-profil så kontaktar vi dig. Intervjuer kommer att hållas löpande, så vi uppmanar dig att söka redan idag. Om du har några frågor angående denna roll, vänligen kontakta anställande chef, saeid.mojtahedzadeh@tietoevry.com.
Hoppas vi hörs snart! *Vi utför bakgrundskontroller av alla slutkandidater.**Tietoevry tackar nej till samtal från rekryteringsföretag.**Tietoevry värdesätter mångfald och vi välkomnar sökande av alla kön, åldrar, förmågor, etniciteter, inriktningar, övertygelser och bakgrunder.*  

Om Tietoevry  

Tietoevry skapar målmedveten teknik som återuppfinner världen för gott. Vi är ett ledande teknikföretag med ett starkt nordiskt arv och global kapacitet. Utifrån våra kärnvärderingar öppenhet, tillit och mångfald, arbetar vi med våra kunder för att utveckla digitala framtider där företag, samhällen och mänskligheten frodas.  

Våra 24 000 experter globalt är specialiserade på moln, data samt mjukvara och bistår tusentals företagskunder och offentliga kunder i mer än 90 länder. Tietoevrys årliga omsättning är cirka 3 miljarder euro och bolagets aktier är noterade på NASDAQ-börsen i Helsingfors och Stockholm samt på Oslo Børs. Bekanta dig med vad vi gör. *Skapar målmedveten teknik för att återuppfinna världen för gott*
At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Universitetsadjunkt i webbprogrammering
emails: bahtijar.vogel@mau.se, sara.leckner@mau.se, magdalena.brossing@mau.se, hr@mau.se, mats.syde@mau.se, sandip.kaur@mau.se
description:
Malmö


Referensnummer P 2024/2128


Malmö universitet är ett nyskapande, urbant och internationellt lärosäte som tack vare engagerade och erfarna medarbetare bidrar till samhällsutveckling. Hos oss arbetar lärare, forskare och andra medarbetare med olika kompetenser tillsammans för att bedriva utbildning och forskning av hög kvalitet. Alla yrkeskategorier och roller är viktiga. Du är välkommen att söka jobb hos oss!



Här kan du läsa mer om hur det är att arbeta på Malmö universitet: Jobba hos oss


**Vi söker**
------------



Universitetsadjunkt i webprogrammering vid Fakulteten för Teknik och samhälle.


**Innehåll och arbetsuppgifter**
--------------------------------



Vi söker en universitetsadjunkt med erfarenhet och kompetens inom programmering med inriktning mot webbutveckling. Som adjunkt kommer du att arbeta med planering, undervisning och examination av kurser på institutionens utbildningsprogram, framför allt inom programmet Medieteknik: Webbaserad design och utveckling. I arbetsuppgifterna ingår även handledning och examination av examensarbeten, samt kursansvar och eventuellt programansvar. Du förväntas även arbeta med program- och kursutveckling och bidra till institutionens utveckling.


**Behörighet**
--------------



Behörig för anställning som universitetsadjunkt är den som dels visat pedagogisk skicklighet, dels har avlagt examen på avancerad nivå eller bedöms ha motsvarande akademisk kompetens eller annan yrkesskicklighet som är av betydelse för anställningens ämnesinnehåll och de arbetsuppgifter som beräknas ingå i anställningen.



En universitetslärare vid Malmö universitet förväntas ha högskolepedagogisk utbildning omfattande minst 15 högskolepoäng, eller motsvarande formaliserad högskolepedagogisk utbildning. Nya medarbetare som saknar denna utbildning ska inom ramen för sin anställning påbörja sådan utbildning inom ett år från anställningens start.



Utöver formell kompetens gäller som allmänt behörighetskrav att universitets medarbetare är lämpade för och har de personliga förmågor i övrigt som behövs för att fullgöra anställningen väl och för att företräda universitetet på bästa sätt.



För denna anställning krävs specifikt:


* Examen på grundnivå i medieteknik, datavetenskap eller motsvarande akademisk kompetens som arbetsgivaren bedömer likvärdigt.
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av webbutveckling, både backend och frontend, inklusive: serverhantering och deployment (Apache, Nginx och Docker), PHP- och JS-implementering av API (REST), avancerade kunskaper i HTML5, CSS3 (inkl. responsiv design), kunskaper i SQL-databashantering (gärna SQLite), versionshantering med Git, kunskap om hantering av linux/terminalen, samt DevOps-principer och verktyg.
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av undervisning och handledning på högskolenivå
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av undervisning på högskolenivå inom webbutveckling, inklusive: avancerad javascript, samt design och utveckling av API i PHP.
* Förmåga att uttrycka sig på svenska i tal och skrift


Särskilt meriterande för denna anställning:


* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av programledning, programutveckling och/eller kursutveckling
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av internet-relaterad utveckling, såsom peer-to-peer (P2P)-filöverföring.
* Kunskap om programmeringsspråk: C, C++, Python, Elixir, Go, etc
* Kunskap om internetsäkerhet.
* Förmåga att uttrycka sig på engelska i tal och skrift

**Bedömningsgrunder**
---------------------



I enlighet med Malmö universitets anställningsordning är bedömningsgrunderna vid anställning som universitetsadjunkt följande:


* Dokumenterad kompetens inom ämnet
* Dokumenterad förmåga till samverkan med aktörer i andra delar av samhället med tydlig anknytning till utbildning och forskning


Med pedagogisk skicklighet avses:


* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av pedagogiskt utvecklingsarbete och en reflekterande redogörelse kring den egna pedagogiska grundsynen och praktiken
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet att med hög kvalitet genomföra utbildning
* Dokumenterad förmåga till forskningsanknytning av utbildning beträffande såväl innehåll som pedagogik

**Fakultet, institution och forskningsmiljö**
---------------------------------------------



Fakulteten för Teknik och Samhälle bedriver utbildning och forskning med fokus på teknik och naturvetenskap vid de två institutionerna för datavetenskap och medieteknik samt materialvetenskap och tillämpad matematik. Fakulteten samverkar med företag och andra organisationer i syfte att höja kompetensnivån, skapa nya produkter, utveckla verksamheter och ge studenterna tidig anknytning till sitt framtida arbetsliv. Våra forskningssamarbeten och medarbetare från ett stort antal länder ger verksamheten en internationell prägel. Mer information finns här: Länk



Institutionen för Datavetenskap och Medieteknik erbjuder forskningsanknutna utbildningar på grundnivå och avancerad nivå i flera ämnen samt forskarutbildning i datavetenskap. Forskningen vid institutionen bedrivs inom datavetenskap, informationssystem, programvaruteknik och medieteknik. Några av de områden vi intresserar oss för inom forskning och utbildning är artificiell intelligens, digitala medier, e-hälsa, Internet of Things, säkerhet och integritet, digitaliseringens samhällskonsekvenser samt spelutveckling. Mer infromation finns här: Länk


**Upplysningar**
----------------



Prefekt, Bahtijar Vogel bahtijar.vogel@mau.se



Enhetschef, Sara Leckner sara.leckner@mau.se



HR-specialist, Magdalena Brossing magdalena.brossing@mau.se



Inför rekryteringsarbetet har Malmö universitet tagit ställning till rekryteringskanaler och marknadsföring. Vi undanber oss därför alla erbjudanden om annonserings- och rekryteringshjälp i samband med denna annons.


**Ansökan**
-----------



 Du söker anställningen via Malmö universitets rekryteringssystem . Du som sökande ansvarar för att ansökan är komplett i enlighet med instruktioner nedan och att den är universitetet tillhanda senast 2025-01-30. Din ansökan ska skrivas på svenska, engelska eller något av de nordiska språken. Du som sökande ansvarar för att din ansökan och dess bilagor översätts vid behov.



I enlighet med Malmö universitets meritportfölj, skall ansökan innehålla:


* Curriculum vitae
* Dokumentation av pedagogisk skicklighet inkl. de arbeten som åberopas, max 3 st. Arbetena laddas upp på urvalsfråga 6.
* Dokumentation av vetenskaplig skicklighet inkl. de arbeten som åberopas, max 3 st. Arbetena laddas upp på urvalsfråga 7.
* Professionell/klinisk skicklighet (om det är aktuellt)
* Akademiskt ledarskap och skicklighet (om det är aktuellt)


Ansökan skall även innehålla:


* Examensbevis samt övriga relevanta betyg och intyg
* Kortfattad redogörelse för vetenskaplig, pedagogisk och annan verksamhet som är av betydelse med hänsyn till den sökta befattningen inklusive en vision om den sökandes framtida forskning och undervisning


Anställning av universitetslärare vid Malmö universitet regleras i Malmö universitets anställningsordning.



Meriterna ska dokumenteras enligt Malmö universitets meritportfölj för lärare/forskare.



Ansökningshandlingar



Vi tar emot ansökningshandlingar digitalt. Fysiska handlingar tas emot endast i undantagsfall. Kontakta hr@mau.se om du har böcker och eventuella andra handlingar som inte kan skickas elektroniskt.


**Övrigt**
----------



Detta är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid.



Malmö universitet är en arbetsplats och ett lärosäte som strävar efter att ha ett öppet och inkluderande synsätt, där jämställdhet och lika villkor tillför mervärde i vår verksamhet.



Malmö universitet tillämpar individuell lönesättning.



Svenska är huvudspråket vid Malmö universitet och det är ett önskemål att medarbetare som inte är svensktalande på sikt tillägnar sig så mycket svenska att de kan delta i det vardagliga och löpande arbetet på institutionen eller avdelningen.



I anställningen ingår 10 procent kompetensutvecklingstid, vilket kan innefatta medverkan i forsknings- och utvecklingsprojekt.


**Tillträde**
-------------



2025-08-18 eller enligt överenskommelse.


**Fackliga företrädare**
------------------------



SACO-S Mats Syde, mats.syde@mau.se



OFR/ST Sandip Kaur, sandip.kaur@mau.se

  


### **Välkommen med din ansökan!**

  

  

Du ansöker senast 2025-01-30

title: R&D Chapter Lead – Firmware Control Products Sweden
description:
**R&D Chapter Lead – Firmware Control Products Sweden**
=======================================================

#### **At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions. That's our story. Make it your story.**

### **Your role and responsibilities**


In this fascinating role, you will manage a chapter of firmware engineer tasked to develop next-generation products and solutions for contactors and softstarters, drive innovation and ensure the maintenance of a large portfolio of existing products. The roughly 10 chapter members are located in Västerås, Sweden. As Chapter Leader, you will be responsible to share best practices & know-how and develop standards & guidelines on how to create and optimize embedded firmware for products used in an industrial environment. Your deep expertise in firmware engineering will enable you to develop through coaching, the members of your chapter. Besides your role as Chapter Leader, you will also, based on your expertise, be part of an Agile Team. You will be part of the Load Control and ELSP chapters leader global community where you will have the responsibility to share best practices and lessons learned. In this role you will be part of the Load Control Agile Unit and report directly to the Agile Unit Leader. • Act as a coach with deep expertise related to embedded firmware development and ensure that chapter members have appropriate competencies and skills • Regularly share best practices and recent developments during alignment meetings on chapter specific topics, both on technical and R&D processes-related topics • Lead the recruitment process of new chapter members and ensure appropriate staffing across agile units • Conduct performance review of chapter members collecting input from relevant stakeholders • Build competences inside the team on managing R&D activities for contactors and softstarters • Secure competences inside the team on the following topics: software architectures, cyber-security, Code Quality and Maintainability, CI/CD, Debugging and Troubleshooting, Hard-ware/Firmware/Mechanical Integration and so on.


### **Qualifications for the role**

* More than 5 years of experience in R&D firmware development. Experience managing in leading R&D teams is an asset but not required.
* Advanced university degree in engineering or related (preferred)
* Strong consultancy, analytical and communication skills demonstrated in a good servant lead-ership practice
* Proven stakeholder management ability preferably in a multicultural environment
* Advanced knowledge of software design tools and processes (Azure DevOps, git, CMake, …)
* Fluency in English

### **More about us**


Recruiting Manager Charles Doiron. Union representatives - Sveriges Ingenjörer: Senad Huijc, +46 730 88 30 06; Ledarna: Lenny Larsson, +46 706 32 85 47, Unionen: Johan Lundström, +46 730 77 03 66. Talent Partner: Ludvig Ahlqvist. We value people from different backgrounds. Could this be your story?. Visit www.abb.com to read more about us and learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe. #MyABBStory ABB Smart Power provides energy distribution solutions for data centers, industrial and manufacturing plants, critical infrastructure and commercial buildings. The Division’s technical teams work closely with industry partners, delivering advanced solutions that support rapid growth, energy transition, and sustainability objectives. The Division’s portfolio includes industrial circuit breakers, low-voltage systems, motor starting applications, and safety devices like switches and relays. Its Power Protection unit supports the world’s largest data center companies with advanced energy-efficient UPS solutions. The Division’s ABB Ability™ Energy Manager provides a scalable, easy-to-use platform that helps organizations save energy and reduce CO2 emissions.
company_description: ABB is a leading global technology company that energizes the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.

title: Associate Technical Director
description:
### **General Information**

**Locations**: Stockholm, Stockholm County, Sweden
  

* Location: Stockholm
* Country: Sweden

  

Role ID
206624
Worker Type
Regular Employee
Studio/Department
CTO - Studio Technology Group
Flexible Work Arrangement
Hybrid
### **Description & Requirements**

We are a global team of creators, storytellers, technologists, experience originators, innovators and so much more. We believe amazing games and experiences start with teams as diverse as the players and communities we serve. At Electronic Arts, the only limit is your imagination.
**We are EA**


For more than fifteen years we've entertained millions of players around the world with our award-winning games. Our teams have expressed their passion for outstanding game feel, audio-visual quality and technical innovation in the Need for Speed, Battlefield and Star Wars Battlefront franchises.


**The Challenge Ahead**
-----------------------


We are DRE (Development & Release Engineering) - a central EA team at the intersection of DevOps, Release Management and Build Engineering. We build, manage and maintain the build pipelines for the majority of EA’s studios worldwide. We are looking for an Associate Technical director for our DRE Cobra team that is based in Europe who can be both hands-on and a people manager for approximately 5 engineers


In your role as an Associate Technical Director, you will help us grow and develop a strong team, setting and driving the execution of technical roadmap with direction from the leadership team You are a experienced software developer with experience in modern software development practices, and have experience working with game build pipelines before. Ideally, you are familiar with diverse DevOps practices such as continuous integration, infrastructure as a code and cloud technologies.


Reporting to a Technical Director, this means building thoughtful engineering teams, partnering with the teams and responsibilities that your teams will support our customers (the game teams) to ensure we can provide services that build the game software and find the fun faster.


**Requirements**
----------------


* Experience leading agile engineering teams while still being hands on
* People management experience (either formal or informal)
* Strong coding skills.
* Worked on a game team, ideally as a tools or build engineer
* Familiarity with CI Systems such as Jenkins, Azure DevOps or similar
* Familiarity with container/VM technologies (Docker, vSphere, and Kubernetes)
* Analytical and methodical problem solving skills

**Would be a bonus**
--------------------


* Monitoring tools like Grafana, Kibana, DataDog
* Experience with As-Code management tools (e.g. Terraform, Ansible, Packer)
* Familiarity with Document Databases (e.g. Elasticsearch, MongoDB)
* Experience with Package repositories (e.g. Artifactory).
