title: Staff Engineer, Merchant
description:
Company Description
  
  

Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to your home or office. Wolt is not just a delivery app – we’re a technology company building a commerce platform to seamlessly connect our millions of customers with thousands of merchant and courier partners, in real-time across 23 countries and 250+ cities. Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry’s highest ratings, largely thanks to our customer-first-mindset, which shows in how we build products and run operations. In June 2022 we officially joined forces with DoorDash. Combined, we have a presence in 27 countries, 23 of which operate with the Wolt brand and app. Wolt and DoorDash continue largely independently, with Wolt’s name, brand, product, technology and team.
  
Working in Product Development at Wolt
  
At Wolt, we’re about getting things done. You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.
  
The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 400+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 40 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.
  
Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion
  
We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.
  
Join us today to build Wolt together!
  
#LI-AP3
  
Job Description
  
  

As a Staff Engineer in the Merchant Group, you’ll have the opportunity to tackle complex engineering challenges at scale, crafting innovative solutions that empower merchants of all sizes to thrive. You'll be key in shaping the technical direction and building products that real people use every day – setting technical direction, fostering alignment across teams, mentoring engineers to ensure we deliver high-quality outcomes efficiently and predictably.
  
Our mission is to help merchants grow their businesses and streamline operations through innovative technology solutions. Whether it’s designing scalable systems, enhancing merchant experiences, or delivering new initiatives, you’ll play a key role in shaping the future of how merchants succeed with Wolt.
  
Qualifications
  
  

**What we're looking for:**  

Proven experience as a staff-level engineer, delivering high-quality, scalable and reliable software in complex and scale-up environments
  
Deep expertise in system design, architecture, and distributed systems, with a thoughtful and pragmatic approach to balancing speed, reliability, and scalability
  
Proven ability to lead significant technical projects across multiple teams, driving technical direction and fostering effective team dynamics - especially in ambiguous or evolving situations
  
Effective communication and technical leadership skills, with an emphasis on building shared understanding to align stakeholders, foster collaboration and deliver impactful, merchant-oriented outcomes
  
Experience mentoring and developing other engineers, fostering a culture of learning and growth, and helping the team continuously raise the bar on technical excellence.
  
  

**You might also have:**  

Experience in the food delivery, e-commerce, or logistics industry, or familiarity with merchant-focused solutions
  
Expertise in one or more programming languages (e.g. Golang, Kotlin, Python), experience with Kubernetes for container orchestration, and familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g. AWS) to build scalable, high-performance products
  
  

Additional Information
  
This role can be based in one of our tech hubs in Helsinki, Berlin or Stockholm, or you can work remotely anywhere in Finland, Sweden, Germany, Denmark, and Estonia. Read more about our remote setup here. If you live outside of these countries - not to worry! We provide relocation support to help you make your way to Finland, Germany or Sweden.
  
  

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right people, so feel free to apply as soon as you feel like hearing more about the position and potentially joining Wolt & Doordash!

title: Junior ingenjör inom laseroptik
description:
Tog du nyligen examen inom teknisk fysikoch vill arbeta med laseroptik? Vi sökernu en nyexaminerad civilingenjör med intresse för problemlösning.Rollen är kopplad till ett talangprogram som ger dig den ultimata övergången mellan studier och arbetsliv.
  
Att jobba som ingenjör inom laseroptik
  
Till en av våra kunder inom försvarsmakten söker vi just nu en ingenjör som ska arbeta med attdesigna optiska och laserbaserade sändare. Din uppgift kommer att vara att utveckla nya lösningar för sändare och optik samt förbättra och underhålla befintliga lösningar.
  
  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer att innefatta:**  

Teoretiska beräkningar
  
Praktiska tester och verifiering
  
Dokumentation av arbetet
  
Produktionsstöd
  
  

Du ska kunna arbeta utifrån kravspecifikationer och förstå hur dessa krav påverkar sändaren.
  
Arbetet sker i nära kontakt med kund, vilket innebär att det är viktigt att du förstår kundens och slutanvändarens behov av produkterna. Du kommer också att arbeta nära tillverkarna, vilket kräver förståelse för tillverkningsprocessen samt förmåga att kommunicera krav och förväntningar på leveranser.
  
För att lyckas i denna roll kommer du att arbeta i ett team med inköp, försäljning samt designers inom mekanik, elektronik, optik och sändarteknik. Du ska utföra dina uppgifter med grundliga undersökningar och ha förmågan att självständigt samla in information från olika källor. Ditt arbetssätt ska vara systematiskt med skriftlig dokumentation som standard.
  
Rollen är placerad i Göteborg med start kring sommaren 2025.
  
Att vara konsult på Nexer Tech Talent
  
Nexer Tech Talent är specialister på att ge unga techtalanger den ultimata starten på arbetslivet. För denna roll kommer du att bli anställd av Nexer Tech Talent men arbeta hos kundföretaget med start kring sommaren 2025.Du kommer även att få ta del av ett skräddarsytt utbildningsprogram där du får möjlighet att utveckla och fördjupa dina tekniska kunskaper i områden som AI, Cloud och cybersäkerhet,men även inom tex. ledarskap och personlig utveckling.
  
Du kommer att coachas av en mentor hos kundsamt en konsultchef på Nexer Tech Talent. Som konsult hos oss blir du väl omhändertagen och bjuds ofta in på gemensamma aktiviteter så som föreläsningar, afterwork och lunchträffar. Efter framgångsrikt genomförande av konsultuppdraget är intentionen att du erbjuds en anställning hos kundföretaget.
  
  

**Vi söker dig som:**  

Är i början av din karriär och har enmasterexamen inomfysik eller motsvarande utbildning med inriktning inomoptik, fotonik och/eller laserfysik
  
Har ett intresse för nyteknik inom optik och sändare
  
Som person är du kommunikativ och noggrann
  
Du drivs av problemlösning och är kvalitetsmedveten
  
Har goda kunskaper i svenska och engelskai både tal och skrift
  
Har goda kunskaper idesign av lasersändare och optisk design
  
  

Denna tjänst kräver godkännande i en säkerhetsprövning i enlighet med svensk säkerhetsskyddslagstiftning.
  
Ansökan
  
Låter detta som något för dig? Vi arbetar löpande med rekryteringen, så skicka in din ansökan snarast möjligt. Om du har du frågor eller funderingar är du välkommen att kontakta Tech Recruiter Johanna Norman på johanna.norman@nexergroup.com
  
Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
  
  

Om Nexer Tech Talent
  
Nexer Tech Talent är en del av Nexer Group – ett techbolag med djupa rötter i svenskt entreprenörskap och innovation. Tillsammans är vi över 2500 medarbetare i 15 länder som i mer än 35 år hjälpt våra kunder att ligga steget före både strategiskt, teknologiskt och kommunikativt. Läs mer om Nexer Tech Talent här.

title: Computer Vision Specialist
description:
About this role
  
We are now looking for an expert, preferably with a PhD, in computer vision, image analysis, machine learning or other areas related to computer vision, as well as talented engineers with extensive industrial experience from these fields.
  
You will be part of cutting-edge computer vision projects as we continue our journey to develop our video analytics solutions. We also actively participate as consultants in select projects in other industries than our own to continuously challenge ourselves. We expect you to participate in the daily work of our systems design and development of algorithms as well as being part of our external consultancy projects from time to time.
  
  

What we offer
  
Our R&D department consists of tight agile teams, where most people contribute to several aspects of the system. We strongly believe in, and our company culture is based on, freedom and responsibility. For us, that means you will be given extensive freedom to make strategic technical decisions while meeting our high standards and making decisions in a responsible way. You will be located at our headquarters in buzzing Lindholmen, Gothenburg, where we are a welcoming team with a lot of positive energy and a strong sense of community.
  
We care for each other and strive to recruit the most skilled and innovative individuals as we believe that every employee truly drives Irisity to success. We promise that you will get your fair share of technical challenges within the field of computer vision and machine learning and a stimulating environment to grow your skill set.
  
  

Who we think you are
  
To be successful in this role, we expect you to have extensive programming experience, such that you can autonomously develop and understand complex source code and algorithms. A thorough understanding of organizational aspects of software development and collaborating efficiently within a development team are indispensable skills for this role. As personal qualities, we value creativity and assertiveness, along with a friendly and collaborative tone and open-mindedness.
  
  

Requirements
  
Proven ability to deliver high-quality results from your previous work and/or state-of-the-art scientific output
  
Ph.D. or M.Sc. related to the fields of computer vision, machine learning or related areas
  
Minimum 5 years of programming experience (in Python or C++)
  
Minimum 4 years of computer vision algorithm development including deep learning
  
A strong desire to collaborate with others and to contribute to team success
  
Proficiency in English. Swedish is a plus but not a requirement.
  
  

Expertise in any of the following areas is advantageous
  
Visual object tracking, camera geometry, and calibration
  
Training machine learning models at scale, including managing large datasets and implementing data pipelines
  
Optimizing models for inference
  
Linux environments, containerization (e.g., Docker), and build tools (e.g., CMake, CircleCI)
  
  

About Irisity
  
At Irisity, we develop video analytics software for the security industry with great respect for personal integrity and privacy, focusing on detecting suspicious activity rather than exposing personal identity. Our system excels at the automatic detection of unwanted activity, such as intruders at construction sites at night, or people climbing roofs or breaking windows. We focus on detecting and preventing criminal activity without registering the identity of regular citizens. At sensitive installations such as schools, our system anonymizes all individuals to hide their identity, to make sure that the invasion of privacy is kept at a zero level. This way, our system can detect what happens and alert, leading to reduced crime rates and increased safety without any negative effects on personal privacy.
  
Irisity AB (publ) is a public company listed at OMX Nasdaq First North, with offices in Sweden, Israel, Hungary, USA, Singapore, the UAE and Brazil. We currently employ a staff of 90+ people within development, sales, support and finance. Our R&D department consists of a computer vision / machine learning team and anexcellent group of system architects, designers and software developers. Our software is packaged into a complete cloud-based SaaS platform marketed towards large global customers and with thousands of cameras connected.
  
We are looking forward to receiving your application. We highly encourage you to apply even if you don’t fulfill all the listed requirements but think you would fit into the role.As a global company, we value diverse, inclusive teams that can contribute to our team success through their unique perspectives, experiences and backgrounds. Selection and interviews will be performed continuously until the role is filled.
  
Read more at www.irisity.com

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
The Senior Data Scientist will play a vital role in advancing AI and machine learning capabilities aimed at Predictive and Proactive Operations. This position requires a combination of technical expertise, analytical thinking, and collaboration to develop data-driven solutions that enhance incident management workflows, ensure SLA compliance, and reduce MTTR. The Senior Data Scientist will work closely with cross-functional teams to build and optimize a robust operational framework.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:****Data Science and Model Development:**  

– Design and implement predictive and prescriptive models to address operational challenges.
  
– Develop algorithms aimed at optimizing incident workflows across multiple systems and improving SLA adherence.
  
– Collaborate with data engineers to build scalable data pipelines and ensure efficient data processing.
  
  

**Incident Management Solutions:**  

– Apply advanced analytics to improve end-to-end incident workflows across various systems.
  
– Leverage machine learning to automate detection, triage, and escalation processes.
  
– Monitor and continuously refine models to ensure accuracy, efficiency, and reliability.
  
  

**Collaboration and Stakeholder Engagement:**  

– Work closely with product teams, service delivery managers, and architects to align data science solutions with business objectives.
  
– Serve as a subject matter expert, providing insights and recommendations to enhance operational processes.
  
– Translate business requirements into actionable data science solutions.
  
  

**Continuous Improvement:**  

– Analyze existing processes to identify inefficiencies and propose data-driven improvements.
  
– Stay current with industry trends, tools, and technologies to integrate best practices into team workflows.
  
– Contribute to building a library of reusable models and solutions to support the broader organization.
  
  

**Data Visualization and Reporting:**  

– Develop dashboards and reports to visualize insights, track SLA compliance, and measure improvements in MTTR.
  
– Effectively communicate findings and progress to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  
  

**Required Qualifications:**  

– Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
  
– Certifications in AI, machine learning, or data engineering are a plus.
  
  

**Experience:**  

– 5+ years of experience in data science, focusing on machine learning and predictive analytics.
  
– Proven track record of deploying machine learning models in production environments.
  
– Previous experience in incident management or operational optimization is highly desirable.
  
  

**Technical Proficiency:**  

– Strong programming skills in Python, R, and SQL.
  
– Proficiency in machine learning frameworks like Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, or PyTorch.
  
– Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., Azure, GCP, AWS) and MLOps tools.
  
– Experience with ITSM platforms (e.g., ServiceNow) and monitoring tools (e.g., Splunk, Dynatrace).
  
  

**Skills:**  

– Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities.
  
– Ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.
  
– Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
  
  

**Preferred Qualifications:**  

– Hands-on experience with Predictive and Proactive Operations or similar domains.
  
– Knowledge of incident, event, or workflow management processes.
  
– Familiarity with SLA-driven operational environments.
  
  

**Key Behaviors:**  

– Data-driven mindset focused on customer-centric solutions.
  
– Proactive and adaptable, with a passion for continuous learning.
  
– Strong collaborative skills, with the ability to work across different teams and departments.
  
  

**Specific Needs in Predictive and Proactive Operations:**  

– Ability to design and implement models that enhance multi-system operational efficiency.
  
– Focus on reducing IT operations incidents, false positive alerts, MTTR, and improving SLA compliance.
  
– Contribution to the development of scalable and reusable data science solutions.

title: Business Data Analyst with Passion for Sustainability
description:
**About Redeploy Vision**  

  

Redeploy Vision is the strategic consulting arm of Redeploy, specializing in helping mid- to enterprise scale organizations unlock value from their data platforms and craft strategies to realize impactful analytical as well as AI use cases.  

  

Our focus is on Data & AI Strategy, Data Management, and delivering Data & AI Solutions. We operate at the intersection of business and technology, helping leading companies solve their most complex challenges and turn bold visions into real business value. We’re not just consultants – we’re trusted advisors who thrive on delivering transformative results.  

  

We are now seeking a Business Data Analyst with a passion for Sustainability based in Gothenburg. If you’re passionate about driving innovation, and influencing the future of industries while driving sustainability, Redeploy Vision is where you belong.  

  

**What it means to be a Business Data Analyst Consultant at Redeploy Vision**  

  

As a Business Data Analyst at Redeploy, you will bridge the gap between data, technology, and sustainability. With your expertise in data analytics, AI, and Cloud solutions, you will empower clients to make informed and impactful decisions that drive their sustainability initiatives and fulfill their CSRD requirements.  

  

As part of our consultancy team, you will deliver the latest solutions that align business strategies with environmental and social goals. Some of your tasks will be:

  

* Using Microsoft Fabric for designing and developing **Power BI** dashboards to visualize sustainability KPIs such as carbon footprint, energy efficiency, and supply chain impact.
* Analyzing and interpreting large datasets to uncover actionable insights that align with clients' business goals.
* Collaborating with clients to define and measure sustainability objectives and legal requirements using data-driven methodologies.
* Supporting cloud-based analytics solutions to integrate and scale sustainability metrics.
* Using tools like the **Microsoft Power Platform** (Power Apps, Power Automate) to automate processes and enhance analytics.
* Applying AI and machine learning techniques for forecasting and impact modeling.
* Communicating data stories effectively to diverse stakeholders, from technical teams to executives.

Guide clients in ensuring CSRD compliance and implement applicable solutions  

* 

**Who Are You?**  

  

You’re a data professional with a passion for solving business and data problems. You thrive in a consultancy environment, working closely with clients and colleagues to solve complex as well as sometimes ambiguous challenges. You’re curious, analytical, and business minded.  

  

**What Experiences Do You Bring?**

  

* Master's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, AI, Machine Learning, Business Analytics, Industrial Engineering with focus on data or related fields.
* Expertise in **Power BI** or similar analytical tools, with a proven ability to create advanced dashboards and reports.
* Experience in data modeling, analytics, and programming (e.g. SQL, Python, R).
* Experience with cloud platforms such as Azure or AWS (preferred), or Google Cloud.
* Prior experience in a consultancy setting.

Business minded and comfortable with ambiguity.  
* 

**And if you come with following experiences, you will stick out from the crowd!**

  

* Familiarity with the **Microsoft Power Platform** for process automation and application development.
* Experience with **Microsoft Fabric** components besides PowerBI.
* A solid understanding of sustainability concepts and ESG reporting.
* Experience working with the CSRD framework.
* Experience in AI/ML applications for analytics and forecasting.
* Fluency in Swedish.

  

*Even if you don’t perfectly match the role, we still encourage you to apply. We believe in diversity and inclusion and welcome all applicants with relevant experience and skills.*  

  

**What We Offer**

  

Being a member of Redeploy means you have the drive and desire to be the best and work smarter than the rest. We enjoy creative freedom with our projects, benefit from great work/life balance, and thrive in a company culture that is both collaborative and supportive. Everything we do at Redeploy is centered around the simple yet effective idea that we all chip in to ensure our success.  

  

To learn more about our benefits, scroll down

 **Location**  

  

We have offices located in central Gothenburg at Stampgatan 14. As we encourage a mix of in-person and remote work to foster innovation and support work-life balance (and like to have fun together), we see that you are based in commuting distance to our office location.

 **How to Apply**  

  

We hope that we have sparked your interest and that you are curious to know more about the role and us at Redeploy.  

  

We will consider applications on an ongoing basis so submit your application as soon as you can by hitting the apply button. To be compliant with GDPR, we only accept applications through our careers channel. Please submit your application using the form on our career website, or any website displaying a position with us.  

  

For any specific questions about the position, reach out to Talent Acquisition Manager Francisca Andersson.

title: Senior Penetration Tester
description:
**About Us**



Integrity360 is one of Europe’s leading cyber security specialists operating from office locations spread out across Europe, providing a comprehensive range of professional, support and managed cyber security services for our 300+ clients. With four top-class Security Operation Centers, we offer a complete end-to-end security services covering our clients’ security from every angle. Our services include Managed Security, Cyber Security Testing, Incident Response, Security Integration, PCI Compliance and Cyber Risk & Assurance services.

  

What sets Integrity360 apart is our excellent team of people that drive the business forward. The company was founded with a focus on technical expertise and that philosophy remains today. The skills and experience in our company are some of the greatest in the industry and clients remain with Integrity360 because they can rely on and trust us to go above and beyond to ensure their needs are met. Listed multiple times on Gartner Market Guides for Managed Security Services.

 **Job Role / Responsibilities**



This is a full-time position with the Integrity360 office in Stockholm, Sweden. The position is responsible for performing all forms of complex technical activities (including the Internal / External Network, Applications, Cloud, Mobile, etc.). These assessments will occasionally be done at the client site, primarily in Sweden. Proficiency in communication is essential, both written and verbal, as well as the ability to convey complex technical information to key international clients.

 **Primary Duties/Responsibilities include:**


* Perform in-depth penetration tests across applications, infrastructure, cloud and mobile platforms.
* Execute zero-knowledge black-box, grey-box and white-box penetration tests of specific areas within the enterprise.
* Perform tests and assessments in the cloud, including but not limited to AWS, Azure, GCP, etc.
* Perform security reviews of servers, network devices, architecture and application designs.
* Act as an escalation point for team members regarding project-related issues.
* Deliver pre-sales support, including project scoping, estimations, and technical assistance via calls, meetings, and presentations with key clients.
* Enhance Integrity360's security offerings, refining methodologies, reporting standards, and educational materials.
* Represent Integrity360 at international events, forums or training events.
* Demonstrate the ability to be an industry expert.

  


**Required Skills / Experience**


* 5+ or more years’ experience in penetration testing or red team operations, including testing critical functionality, banking systems and more.
* Manual penetration testing experience above and beyond running automated tools.
* Expertise in AWS, Azure, and cloud-native technologies, including VMs, containers, and infrastructure as code.
* Previous experience as a Subject Matter Expert, or similar role.
* Experience in testing ICS, SCADA, mainframes, containers, hardware appliances,
* Excellent understanding of firewalls, proxies, iptables, AVs and EDR products, VPNs, IDS/IPS, and various networking concepts.
* Knowledge of wireless technologies, mainly RF, Cellular, NFC, and Bluetooth technology.
* Experience in testing OSX / iOS and Android devices.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills in front of key clients.
* Experience in developing custom security tools and scripts.
* Fluency in one or more programming or scripting languages: Java, Python, C/C++, C#, .NET, ASP, PHP,

  


**Certifications/Qualifications**


* One or more industry leading certification (OSCP, CRTE, CRTO, OSCE, OSWP, ARTE, CPTS, etc.)
* CHECK Team Leader or equivalent is a plus.
* Computer Sciences, IT or Cybersecurity related degree is a plus.

  


**Working at Integrity360**



At Integrity360 we aim to reflect what’s important through the benefits we offer. We survey our people regularly and encourage discussions around these tops so we can understand what really makes a difference. Our benefits priorities are physical, mental and financial wellbeing.

 **Mental & Physical wellbeing benefits:**


* Private healthcare provided by Attunda Hälsan
* Health insurance provided by Söderberg and Partners
* Onsite Gym (Kista office)
* SEK 5,000.00/year for Friskvårdbidrag, our allowance can be used for Gym memberships, to improve health and more!

  


**Financial wellbeing:**



We guarantee that every employee will have their pay reviewed at least once every year, if not more regularly. We aim to pay within the market range for all roles and keep pace with inflation on average.



What we offer:


* Twice yearly salary reviews
* 6% Contributory Pension
* Income Protection
* Death-in-Service cover

  


**Other benefits include:**


* 30 days’ annual leave and options to carry over 5 days to the next financial year
* Our L&D program, we work with various platforms including Cybrary, Udemy, Preply, Pluralsight, Swift and HTB ensuring our people are up to date with their industry knowledge. Offering opportunities to further upskill and gain industry leading certifications.
company_addresses: Integrity360, The Concourse, Block D, Beacon Court, Sandyford, Co. Dublin, Ireland
company_description: Integrity360 is one of Europe's leading cyber security services and solutions provider.

title: R&D Manager – Nimbra Applications (Stockholm, hybrid)
description:
Do you want to take the next step in your career and contribute to innovative solutions in media technology? **Net Insight** is a leader in enabling live broadcast experiences for audiences worldwide. With over 25 years in the industry, we develop products that ensure seamless media delivery over various platforms, including cloud-based systems.


We’re seeking an **R&D Manager** to join our team in **Solna, Stockholm**, to help drive the development of our Nimbra Applications. This is an excellent opportunity to work with a talented team and contribute to cutting-edge solutions in media transport technology!

 *Want to learn more about our products and get to know our people? Make sure to check us out on* ***LinkedIn*** *and* ***Youtube****!*

 **About the role:**


As an **R&D Manager** for Nimbra Applications, you will play a key role in leading and developing a team of 15–20 developers and consultants. Working closely with another R&D Manager, you will ensure the success of the Nimbra Applications organization by combining technical leadership with strategic direction.


Key Responsibilities:

* **Team Leadership**: Lead, motivate, and support the development team to achieve high-quality results.
* **Recruitment and Growth**: Take responsibility for recruiting new talent and fostering the professional growth of the team.
* **Technical Decision-Making**: Drive the team towards the best technical solutions, ensuring alignment with business needs and future product demands.
* **Project Management**: Oversee and monitor product development projects, ensuring they meet technical and functional requirements within set timelines.
* **Strategic Direction**: Set clear priorities for the team, guiding the development and implementation of key technologies.
* **Troubleshooting**: Support troubleshooting efforts within R&D and production to resolve issues effectively.
* **Knowledge Sharing**: Ensure the team has access to the tools and channels needed to stay current with evolving industry standards and technologies.

 **Your Profile:**

* You have broad technical experience and are familiar with **agile methodologies** like Scrum.
* Experience in **embedded software** and **FPGA development** is a strong asset. Knowledge of cloud technologies is also valued.
* You’ve worked in **technical leadership roles**, managing development teams or R&D departments.
* You’re comfortable balancing **technical decisions** with project management, ensuring deadlines and goals are met.

It is a plus with Product Management and/or Project Manager experience as well as experience in production-oriented companies.  
* 

**Your Leadership Approach:**

* You lead by example and create a supportive environment where your team can thrive.
* You’re **organized and adaptable**, able to prioritize tasks and adjust to shifting needs.
* Your leadership style emphasizes **collaboration and problem-solving**, making it easy to work across teams.

If you’re passionate about technology and want to contribute to the next generation of media solutions, we’d love to hear from you!

 **Our culture and beliefs:**


At Net Insight, **innovation**, **collaboration**, and **trust** are the cornerstones of our success. As one team, we are committed to delivering value to our customers, contributing to the growth and success of our company.


Together we create a dynamic and positive workplace where everyone is valued, engaged and empowered to make an impact

**How to apply and information about the process**


It's super-easy!


Upload you CV or use your LinkedIn profile, fill in the choice questions (no data entry) and upload relevant documentation of you choice - That's it.


We are recruiting continuously and we aim to get back to you with an initial decision within 10 days.


Note: We do not offer relocation support at this time.


Note 2: Background check will be part of our recruitment process.

 **This is NET INSIGHT**

*Net Insight (Nasdaq: NETI B) provides the highest performing, most open video transport and media cloud technology for content providers as the industry standard for flexibility and service across live contribution, distribution and remote production media workflows.*

*For over 25 years, the world’s leading content owners, broadcasters, production companies, service providers and enterprises have trusted Net Insight’s Emmy Award winning Nimbra technology to guarantee media delivery. Today, Net InsiEmmy Awardght partners with hundreds of customers in over 70 countries to ensure media flows across managed and unmanaged IP networks, and the cloud – from anywhere, to everywhere. It enables customers to get the best from any mix of virtualized, cloud and IP technology and is the only platform to support all the major industry standards, protocols and clouds.*

  

For more information, please visit *www.**netinsight.net*

title: AWS Cloud Specialist

description:

 At Redeploy Build, we are cloud specialists. What we do is build and integrate best-in-breed cloud environments, steering clear of legacy constraints and “old-IT”.

title: Technical Product Manager - Shared Components (Real Time Communication)
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**About The Role**
 We're seeking a highly motivated and experienced Technical Product Manager to own and drive the roadmap and requirements for critical shared components within our Real Time Communication product suite. You will be the key link between engineering, product and product operation stakeholders, ensuring alignment and successful delivery of impactful solutions.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Our Real-Time Communication team is building the future of real time communication for enterprises! We're passionate about creating seamless and engaging experiences across a suite of products that connect people worldwide. This includes programmable voice, in-app calling, verification, number lookup and fax solutions. All of these products generate billions of events every year that results in insightful and business critical data both for us at Sinch and for our customers. As we continue to grow and innovate, we need a talented Technical Product Manager to lead the charge of our platform team, Shared Components.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Define and implement a strategy for collecting, analysing, and leveraging AI and usage data across all RTCx products.
* Define roadmap and requirements for our common financial and business intelligence pipelines.
* Define roadmap and requirements for our configuration tool used for operating all RTCx products.
* Work closely with product managers across different RTCx products and Sinch to ensure seamless integration and consistent data model and standard.
* Provide technical guidance and support to the engineering team, contributing to architectural decisions and technology choices.


**Requirements**
* Professional experience as a Technical Product Manager with a focus on backend systems, data platforms or API based products.
* Experience of defining and detailing requirements.
* Strong knowledge of data flows, billing, account management, and configuration tools in large-scale systems.
* Proven track record of managing complex, cross-functional projects with a focus on scaling and reliability.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and various stakeholders.
* Technical background or experience with backend development, data infrastructure and analytics is highly preferred.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to deep dive into the technical details and complexity.
* Familiarity with data privacy regulations (e.g. GDPR) and AI.


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Corporate Account Executive, Google Cloud
job_function: Sales, General Business, and Customer Service
company_industry: Information Services and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**Minimum qualifications:**
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
* 7 years of sales experience in the technology industry with SaaS, PaaS or IaaS products and platforms.
* Experience engaging with accounts, selling a portfolio of products at C-level.


**Preferred qualifications:**
* Experience with large, complex commercial and legal negotiations working with procurement, legal, and business teams.
* Experience promoting Google Cloud computing technologies to mid-size organizations across geographies.
* Experience working with greenfield business customers or existing customers.
* Ability to collaborate effectively across organizational boundaries, build relationships, and import and export talent and ideas to achieve a broader organizational goal.
* Fluent in Swedish language in order to manage relationships with local and international customers.


**About the job** 
 Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Build and deepen executive relationships with enterprise customers, bring to Google your mature C-level relationships to help us grow into new organizations.
* Discuss and manage end-to-end complex business-cycles, often presenting to C-level executives in corporate customers.
* Lead account strategy in generating and developing business growth opportunities, working collaboratively with Customer Engineers, and Google Partners.
* Understand each customer’s technology footprint, strategic growth plans and business drivers, technology strategy and external landscape.
* Drive business development, forecast accurately, and achieve strategic goals by leading customers through the entire business cycle.


 Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

title: Presales Solutions Consultant
description:
**This is Mevisio**
 Mevisio is a growing start-up, offering a low-code platform that digitizes management and collaboration in the manufacturing industry. We have been around since 2017 and today, we have a fantastic portfolio of well known enterprise manufacturing companies globally!
   

  

 We provide a digital alternative to the physical whiteboards traditionally used for daily team meetings on the shop floor, with applications extending to general operations management and other Lean Manufacturing practices. The Mevisio Platform is a tool for leaders and team members to work smarter and more efficiently through visualization, improved communication and real time data.
   

  

 We are digitizing the manufacturing industry all over the world - want to join us
 *?*
**Why Mevisio?**
 We have an inclusive and friendly driven culture! Our values are central in our daily work:
 *Customer First, Better Together, People* 
 Matters and
 *Aim High!* 
 We have high ambitions but we know how important cross-collaboration and teamwork is in order to succeed. Every voice is important and we need motivated people onboard to do this - we need YOU!
   

  

 With our platform, supporting the daily operations in big manufacturing industries internationally, we have the possibility to make an impact in the world. We are not done yet, we have a lot more to achieve - let's do that together!
   

  

**What will you do?**
 If you find yourself in the middle of technique and business, with a passion for digitizing the manufacturing industry, we are now looking for a passionate and driven
 **Presales Solutions Consultant** 
 to join our commercial team.
   

  

 You'll act as a domain expert for our customers by applying your technical, industrial and business expertise. As a Presales Solutions Consultant at Mevisio, you and our sales people, will work closely together and act as the trusted advisor. You will ensure smooth sales cycles and help customers succeed by identifying their business needs and translating them into real-life solutions using our low-code platform, and guide them to reach operational excellence.
   

  

 Except from this, you will also play an important role to provide feedback to our product development by providing feedback to our Product and Engineering team. The position includes travels.
   

  

**Tasks In Your Daily Work**
* Build strong and engaging relationships with our customers through passion for technique and business.
* Collaborate with our sales team to understand customer needs and design customized solutions, with new and existing customers.
* Lead engaging product demonstrations, showcasing Mevisio’s platform and capabilities.
* Solve issues or technical problems to help our customers reach operational excellence.
* Partner with customers to translate their requirements into successful implementations.
* Deliver captivating presentations to new and existing customers, highlighting values and advantage of our platform.
* Configuring our platform using JavaScript and JSON.
* Become a trusted advisor, providing insights and recommendations to maximize value and customer success.
* Gather customer feedback to inform future product innovations.


**What We Think You Will Bring To Us**
* 3-5 years of experience in Presales or Technical consulting.
* Experience from manufacturing industry.
* Proven experience leading technical initiatives within complex organizations.
* The experience of managing diverse stakeholders across various levels.
* A passion for technology and innovation, with a knack for problem-solving.
* Strong communication skills.
* The ability to convey complex technical concepts in a simple way.
* Technical skills within JavaScript (JSON is a plus).
* Fluent in Swedish and English (German is a plus).


**Personal Skills**
* A customer-centric mindset, ready to put our Customer First value into action.
* A positive and go-get them attitude!
* Team-oriented approach!
* An ambassador for our value Aim High!


**Other Perks And Benefits**
 🚆 Near public transit
   

  

 🏖️ Paid Holiday
   

  

 📈 Pension plan
   

  

 🪐 Development opportunities
   

  

 🔕 Flexible working hours
   

  

 👨‍👩‍👧 Work-life balance (we use a hybrid work set up)
   

  

 👟 Gym around the corner
   

  

 🎊 Social gatherings
   

  

 🏢 Central Office
   

  

 🧑🏾‍💻 New tech gear
   

  

 ☕️ Free Coffee/Tee
   

  

 🥂 Free Thursday bubbles
   

  

**We hope you feel excited about the position and we would love to get to know you more!**
 Every year, Deloitte ranks Sweden's fifty fastest growing technology companies, in their Sweden Technology Fast 50 list. With a revenue growth of 914% over the last four years, 2018-2021, Mevisio made it to number 34 on the list. Adding to the achievement, the growth has been made with no external funding.
   

  

 – We are glad to see that our hard work has payed off. We are a small, dedicated team that is committed to providing an enterprise grade platform to our customers with the best user experience there is. Our customers have tough requirements when it comes to service delivery and information security—every new customer is an achievement. I'm really proud of the team that has made this possible, says Marcus Wejderot, CEO of Mevisio.

title: Aspirerande Industridoktorand - Sectra Communications
description:
Vill du utveckla din expertis inom något av våra forskningsområden samtidigt som du gör skillnad och bidrar till en säkrare värld?
  
  

Sectra Communications är en ledande leverantör inom cybersäkerhet och informationssäkerhet. Här utvecklas lösningar inom kryptering och IT-säkerhet för att stärka samhällets säkerhet och skydda känslig information, både i Sverige och Europa.
  
  

Nu söker vi en junior forskningsingenjör som har ambitionen att gå vidare till en tjänst som industridoktorand, till vår forskningsavdelning. Avdelningen har som ansvar att utveckla kunskap, metoder och prototyper som banar väg för framtidens säkra kommunikationslösningar och cybersäkerhetsprodukter.
  
  

**Våra huvudspår för forskningsområdena är följande:**  

Metoder för högassuransprodukter
  
Metoder för säker användning av obetrodda produkter och tjänster
  
Framtidens kryptografi och dataskydd
  
  

Att vara industridoktorand hos oss innebär att kombinera det bästa av två världar. Du får möjlighet att fördjupa dig i forskningsfronten och avancera inom ditt expertområde, samtidigt som du arbetar praktiskt med att omsätta forskningen i verkliga, användbara produkter.
  
  

Rollen
  
  

I rollen som junior forskningsingenjör med ambition mot industridoktorand hos Sectra Communications kommer du att jobba i ett team med forskare och ha nära samarbete med akademiska experter globalt. Vidare kommer du att:
  
  

Delta i forskningsavdelningens interna projekt
  
Bidra till skrivandet vid ansökningar av forskningsmedel
  
Arbete i nära anslutning till våra utvecklingsavdelningar
  
Några av våra medarbetare
  
CARL FOLKESSON
  
Software Engineer
  
"In every part of my work there is a problem that needs to be analyzed and resolved, and the feeling when you finally resolve that problem is one of the best feelings in the world."
  
JOHAN CARLEGRIM
  
General Manager
  
"For me, Sectra is a great place to work. While everyone at Sectra is highly skilled and professional, they are also easy-going and friendly."
  
Kvalifikationer
  
  

Denna roll är en unik möjlighet som kräver engagemang och flexibilitet. Du behöver ha en positiv inställning till de utmaningar som forsknings- och industrivärlden erbjuder, och se detta som en väg till en belönande och utvecklande karriär. Vi lägger större vikt vid din potential än den kunskap och erfarenhet du besitter idag. Om du är en snabblärd person med en strävan att utvecklas kan vi lära dig det som krävs för tjänsten.
  
  

**För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har:**  

En civilingenjörsexamen inom datavetenskap, teknisk fysik eller ett närliggande område.
  
Flytande svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.
  
Ett starkt intresse för att omvandla avancerad teknologi till praktiska lösningar inom cybersäkerhet.
  
Mycket goda akademiska resultat och en stark vilja att lära dig och behärska nya tekniska metoder.
  
  

För denna tjänst behöver du ett svenskt medborgarskap då vi jobbar med säkerhetsklassad information.
  
  

Vi erbjuder
  
  

Möjligheten att arbeta med teknologier som spelar en avgörande roll för samhällets säkerhet.
  
Möjligheten att lära dig om, och driva framstegen inom, ett av de mest betydelsefulla teknikområdena i vår tid.
  
En inspirerande och utmanande arbetsplats där du arbetar tillsammans med smarta och begåvade kollegor, både inom industrin och akademin.
  
En organisation där du blir hörd och har en verklig möjlighet att påverka.
  
  

Vi läser ansökningar och kallar in till intervju löpande. Här kan du läsa mer om hur det är att jobba på Sectra, och här kan du läsa mer om vår rekryteringsprocess.
  
  

Vi har riktigt bra förmåner
  
  

Göra skillnad
  
  

Personlig utveckling
  
  

Global miljö
  
  

Grymma kollegor
  
  

Innovation och teknologi
  
  

Kundfokus
  
  

Om företaget
  
  

Sectra develops and sells cutting-edge solutions for medical IT and cybersecurity. We help hospitals and those who are training future healthcare personnel to improve their efficiency so that patients can receive better care. We also support and help defense, authorities, and critical social functions to secure their communication against eavesdropping and protect their systems against unauthorized access. This is how we create conditions for a healthier and safer society.
  
  

One thing that identifies us at Sectra is our customer obsession— our ability and willingness to understand, create value for and stand up for our customers. This shared priority is at the core of our culture. Our customers describe this as having the knowledge to meet expectations, the passion to exceed them. As we hire for attitude and ability - train for skill, we happily expand your knowledge, if you bring the passion and willingness to learn.
  
  

Niklas Johansson | Kontaktperson
company_description: The company was founded in 1978, has its head office in Linköping with subsidiaries in 19 countries and operates through partners worldwide.

title: Lead Electrical Design Engineer
description:
**Lead Electrical Design Engineer**
===================================

#### **At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions. That's our story. Make it your story.**

### **This position reports to**


Engineering Manager

### **Your role and responsibilities**


ABB Marine & Ports designs and develops intelligent terminal automation solutions and services for container and bulk cargo handling as well as world-leading technologies that are driving the evolution of sustainable shipping. Data-driven decision support and integrated solutions for ship and shore from ABB are paving the way to a zero-emission marine industry, and optimized container terminals. Our automation and electrical solutions are making port and terminal operations safer, greener and more productive. ABB Marine & Ports operates in 26 countries and has 2,000 employees. Learn more about what we do at www.abb.com/ports You will be responsible for the electrical design scope in assigned projects and together with the project manager and the software lead ensure that all project deliveries are fulfilled on time and within budget. As Lead Engineer you will work with junior colleagues and provide guidance for their work. You will have frequent interactions with customers, suppliers, internal technicians, and support teams. Preparing the electrical design and integration of container cranes which includes several interesting technical areas such as driveline, automation equipment as well as MV and LV switchgears. Making technical recommendations in the design, engineering, testing, installation, and commissioning phases of customer projects to ensure all actions are completed according to process requirements and standards. Collaborating and networking with engineering colleagues, sharing best practice across different projects and disciplines. Identifying areas for improvement and having capability to take lead in these. Helping customers resolve technical issues both remotely and on domestic and international customer sites. Maintaining and enhancing customer satisfaction by providing excellent service at all stages of the project.

### **Qualifications for the role**

* A Bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering or similar field. Alternatively, you could have a Higher Vocational Education
* together with several years of work experience.
* Preferably, more than 4 years of experience working as electrical design engineer in delivery projects or with products.
* Experience of Engineering Base, Eplan or similar tools.
* A high level of self-motivation, curiosity and desire to learn about new technologies.
* A collaborative, solutions-oriented approach and strong communication skills.
* Fluency in English and Swedish both written and spoken is mandatory.
* If you don’t have experience enough to meet the requirements for a lead role, there is still a possibility to join our team as
* a project engineer working with electrical design with the ambition to develop both yourself and our solutions.

### **More about us**


Bring your very own sense of pride and purpose as you help us drive forward the Fourth Industrial Revolution – creating a sustainable future for our planet, and your career. Join ABB and harness the power of our diverse global network, as you collaborate with and learn from our world-class teams. Above all, challenge yourself every day. Let’s write the future, together. Recruiting Manager: Mikael Eriksson, +46 724 612 243, will answer your questions about the position. Union representatives - Sveriges Ingenjörer: Mikael Blomkvist, +46 768 06 00 11, Unionen: Krista Andersson, +46 706 44 02 85, Ledarna: Leif Öhrberg, +46 724 64 40 16. All other questions can be directed to Talent Partner: Irma Leijon +46 724 612 314. We kindly decline direct contact with staffing and recruitment agencies as well as sellers of additional job advertisements. We value people from different backgrounds. Could this be your story? Apply today or visit www.abb.com to read more about us and learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe. #MyABBStory
company_description: ABB is a leading global technology company that energizes the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.

title: Test Engineer (TestStand)

Vi letar nu efter en Test Engineer för spännande uppdrag.



Den perfekta kandidaten har väldigt bred kompetens och har tidigare jobbat med både elektronik, mekanik samt mjukvaruutveckling. Viktigaste är att man har lång erfarenhet med att ha jobbat med TestStand.

Som person är du social och har ett stort intresse för teknik. Du är självgående, drivande och noggrann i ditt arbete. Som konsult på Sigma är det också viktigt att ha god förståelse för kundens önskemål samt teknikens möjligheter.

Med mångfald, delaktighet och entreprenörskap stärker och utvecklar vi vår verksamhet och våra medarbetare.*

description:

Relocation friendly


Automated Testing Python


Automotive Industry

##### **Project description**

Participate in the process of test system flow by defining test activities, equipment, asset under test and DUT (Device Under Test) preparedness together with requirement owner and suppliers.


##### **Responsibilities**


Be responsible for the VCU component verification, i.e. black and white box test, acceptance test and regression test on deliverables from supplier (both inhouse and external)


Automate test cases in vTestStudio for Component-/Domain


and Complete testing in bench rig, HIL and on Vehicle. Test Cases to automate are from all functional areas within Door, Alarm and Tailgate not just VCU.


Create and maintain automation test framework in Python and C++ (EMON).


Test methods & test case development in Carweaver, planning and coordination of test activities together with rest of the team.


Create Fault reports and assign to receiver in such way that an investigation and solution can be provided under function or system owners leadership. Review and communicate with suppliers' test reports and results.


Independently take logs and measurement on the component and actuators and signals.


In collaboration with developer analyze logs to identify faults.


Ensure the work is delivered as per specified acceptance criteria and definition.


Read out and analyze nightly runs in our HILs

Must have


Programming knowledge in Python and C++

Experience from automotive industry

title: Regular System Safety Engineer
description:
Goeteborg, Sweden


Relocation friendly


Functional Safety


Automotive Industry


13/12/2024


Req. VR-110292


  
##### **Project description**

Deceleration department, responsible for the vehicle braking and developing for conventional and AD controlled vehicles.  

  

Customer is going to expand in-house development to today's supplier developed SW solutions and research future systems for their portfolio, such as brake by wire and redundant systems. Customer works with platform solutions where they strive to lead and shape the development on future platforms.


##### **Responsibilities**


Your responsibility will be System Safety Engineering for the Brake System including SW, HW, Pedals.


The work includes safety analysis of the defined system design, covering methodologies such as FTA, FMEA and FMEDA.


It also includes defining and reviewing the Technical Safety Concepts for the product.


Compliance towards ISO 26262 and working according to Volvo Cars defined system safety processes is an obvious part of the responsibility.


The role requires a lot of collaboration with colleagues in the team, with other teams within Vehicle Platform, Suppliers and other parts of R&D.


Perform System Safety Joint Reviews with the Supplier


Perform Verification Reviews on safety work products including Test specification.


You support your organization's System Safety Deviation handling.


You act as a System Safety contact person for your organization.


Handling and breakdown of legal requirements.


##### **Skills**


Must have


Masters/Bachelor's degree in Controls and Mechatronics, Electrical/Electronic or Computer Science Engineering or equal


10 years of experience in Electrical Engineering, Mechatronics Engineering or a related field.


Proficiency in Systems Engineering within Chassis domain.


In-depth Knowledge on Functional Safety (ISO 26262)


6 years of experience as System Safety Engineer/Functional Safety Manager or equivalent role.


Experience in analysis methodologies (TSC, FTA, FMEDA, FMEA) and processes/methods/tools for functional safety.


Experience with development in safety critical software.


You communicate clearly and concisely, in written and spoken English.


You thrive in situations where the answer is unknown, but the challenge is in finding a solution that is an optimal tradeoff between the needs of different stakeholders.


Nice to have


You communicate clearly and concisely, in written and spoken English.


You thrive in situations where the answer is unknown, but the challenge is in finding a solution that is an optimal tradeoff between the needs of different stakeholders.


##### **Other**


Languages


English: C1 Advanced


Seniority


Regular

title: Sales Admin
description:
Urval sker löpande Lund
  
  

Ordning och reda möter action!
  
  

Pluggar du ekonomi, IT, systemvetenskap eller management? Letar du efter ett meriterande extrajobb där du kan kombinera arbete med dina studier? Vi söker just nu en Sales Admin för en timanställning på cirka två dagar i veckan på vårt huvudkontor i Lund (vid Sankt Lars). Anställning startar vid årsskiftet 2025 och är en fantastisk möjlighet att kombinera studier med värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet.
  
  

Vad kommer du att göra?
  
  

Du kommer att stötta vårt Lime CRM-säljteam, bestående av cirka 60 säljare runt om i Europa och bidra till att hålla säljprocesserna i toppform. Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter inkluderar:
  
  

**Uppdatera och hantera leadslistor:** Säkerställa att våra listor alltid är korrekta och uppdaterade, samt skapa nya leads för våra säljare.
  
**Kommunikation med stakeholders:** Göra tydliga och engagerande utskick om vunna affärer, men också dela nyheter och uppdateringar om vad som händer med vår produkt och organisation.
  
**Lost-analys:** Ta kontakt med förlorade affärer för att samla insikter och hjälpa oss att bli ännu bättre.
  
**Kontrollera och åtgärda i systemet:** Identifiera och rätta till avvikelser som exempelvis försenade actions, felaktiga statusar eller saknade stakeholders för att säkerställa att våra säljprocesser flyter smidigt.
  
Några av våra medarbetare
  
Anna-Mari Ewing
  
Sales Operations Specialist
  
"Om du ger uttryck för dina ambitioner och vad du behöver för stöd, så finns det stora möjligheter att utveckla din karriär med oss."
  
Matilda Alm
  
Account Manager
  
"På Lime trivs jag med fantastiska kollegor och en inspirerande kultur. Möjligheterna att utmanas och växa som säljare gör varje dag spännande och unik."
  
Terry Ilebode
  
Software Engineer
  
"Lime ger mig ett holistiskt stöd i alla delar av mitt liv genom att både utmana mig som mjukvaruutvecklare och ge mig stöd i min personliga utveckling."
  
Henrik Kjærvik
  
Head of Expert Services
  
"Det bästa med att jobba på Lime, förutom kollegorna så klart, är flexibiliteten och möjligheterna att utveckla din karriär i linje med dina egna mål och ambitioner."
  
Kvalifikationer
  
  

Vem är du?
  
  

Vi söker dig som är student, gärna vid universitet eller högskola, och letar efter ett utvecklande extrajobb vid sidan av dina studier. Du är en person som trivs med att ha koll på läget och som gillar att bidra till ordning och struktur.
  
  

**Strukturerad och organiserad:** Du har ett öga för detaljer och ser till att inget faller mellan stolarna.
  
**Initiativrik och självgående:** Du tar ansvar och vågar driva saker framåt på egen hand.
  
**Kommunikativ och professionell:** Du kan uttrycka dig klart och tydligt, både på svenska och engelska, och alltid med en professionell ton.
  
**Serviceminded:** Du är lyhörd, hjälpsam och sätter teamets framgång i fokus.
  
**Trygg och beslutsam:** Du står upp för dina idéer och beslut, och kan göra det på ett konstruktivt och förtroendeingivande sätt.
  
  

Tjänsten är en timanställning där du förväntas arbeta ungefär två dagar i veckan på vårt kontor i Lund. Observera att detta är en renodlad timanställning och att den inte övergår i en heltidsanställning.
  
  

Vad erbjuder vi?
  
  

Helt ödmjukt kan vi berätta att vi har en fantastisk kultur på Lime!
  
  

Vi bjuder på frukost varje måndag, daglig trefika med gofika på fredagar samt wellness- och aktivitetsgrupper på respektive kontor som anordnar gemensamma aktiviteter. Vi tycker om att umgås med varandra – att ha kul och att prestera går hos oss hand i hand!
  
  

När kan du börja?
  
  

Vi är flexibla med startdatum men söker någon som kan börja relativt omgående, önskvärt 7 januari.
  
  

Processen?
  
  

Vi tillämpar löpande urval, vilket innebär att vi driver rekryteringsprocessen kontinuerligt tills vi hittat den perfekta matchningen. I första steget screenar vi din ansökan. Därefter följer en digital intervju med din blivande chef och därefter en intervju på plats följt av referenstagning. Vår process avslutas alltid med en slutintervju med vår VD Nils.
  
  

Konferenser och sociala aktiviteter
  
  

Träning och utveckling
  
  

Balans i (jobb)livet
  
  

Kaffe, dricka och fika
  
  

Hälsa och välmående
  
  

Bygga Lime tillsammans
  
  

Om företaget
  
  

Lime är ett börsnoterat techbolag med 9 kontor i 6 länder. Vi växer konstant med ca 20 % per år och öppnade under hösten 2020 vårt första utomnordiska kontor i Nederländerna. Sedan dess har vi äntrat Tyskland och har ständigt ögonen öppna för nya, potentiella marknader. Men det där är bara siffror och fakta. Det riktigt härliga med Lime är vi som jobbar här - ett stort gäng omtänksamma, ambitiösa kollegor som kämpar för en värld där alla kundupplevelser överträffar förväntningarna. Med hjälp av smart teknik och träffsäker expertis förenklar vi kunders vardag och skapar förutsättningar för det där lilla extra. Något som fortfarande är unikt för ett mjukvarubolag som Lime är också att vi sköter hela produktlivscykeln själva - allt från utveckling, till leverans, till support. Vi tar helt enkelt ansvar för att kedjan är hel och välfungerande, med en twist. Vi kallar det #dontbreakthechain.
  
  

Lime grundades av tre studenter i Lund år 1990
  
  

Lime klimatkompenserar genom grön el från en solcellspark utanför Sjöbo
  
  

Lime har gjort sex företagsförvärv sedan år 2017
  
  

Limes nuvarande VD Nils började som en av de första traineerna år 2006
  
  

Lime introducerades på Nasdaq i Stockholm år 2018
  
  

Lime lanserade sitt omvända mentorskapsprogram år 2019
  
  

Limes mjukvara har en räckvidd på ca 100 miljoner människor dagligen
  
  

Sara Pennsäter Åkesson | Kontaktperson
company_description: Looking for a boring employer? Look elsewhere! At Lime, we love customer care, sales and case management! We love to deliver that “something special” – while having a lot of fun along the way.

title: Account Manager
description:
Urval sker löpande Göteborg
  
  

Har du insett att försäljning och affärsutveckling är ditt home turf? Vill du sälja mjukvara som optimerar förutsättningarna för dina kunder att bli sina bästa jag? Är du en hunter som drivs av resultat och personlig utveckling? Perfekt! Just nu letar vi efter dig som vi bli en del av vårt härliga säljteam i Göteborg. Välkommen till Lime!
  
  

Vad kommer du att göra?
  
  

Som Account Manager ansvarar du för hela säljprocessen från första kontakt till ett färdigt förhandlat avtal, och alla steg däremellan. Hos Lime prospekterar vi, bokar egna möten, kvalificerar kund, demar lösningen, och stänger affären.
  
  

Då vi säljer CRM-system med tillhörande konsulttjänster kan du se fram emot komplexa försäljningsprocesser där din uppgift är att hitta och övertyga kunden, men också att identifiera deras behov och utamningar för att kunna definiera specifika lösningar. Du kan förvänta dig kontakt med C-levelpersoner på landets medelstora och stora företag inom olika branscher genom uppsökande försäljningsarbete, såsom:
  
  

Prospektering på såväl varma som kalla leads
  
Nätverkande / relationsförsäljning
  
Konferenser och mässor
  
Kundmöten och presentationer både fysiskt och digitalt
  
Säljprocesser med fokus på att skapa värde i kundens arbetsprocesser
  
Social selling, eller på det vis som ger dig bäst resultat
  
  

Vilka är vi?
  
  

Först och främst måste vi börja med att skryta om vårt sprilllans nya kontor på Kungsporstavenyn 37 med den storslagna utsikten över Avenyn. Något annat som vi gillar att nämna är såklart vår berömda fika-kultur, där vi förutom fika gillar att spendera pauserna vid pingisbordet eller varför inte hänga med på en springtur med vårt kära wellness team? Listan är lång med saker vi gärna gillar att dra ihop på detta kontor!
  
  

Totalt är vi cirka 60 kollegor i Göteborg med en härlig mix av diverse roller inom bolaget. Förutom detta kommer du få runt 70 härliga säljkollegor i Sverige och runt 400 kollegor i Europa. Hos oss karaktäriseras säljkulturen av människor som vill bygga ett starkt team och samtidigt drivs av den individuella prestationen. Vi hjälps åt och det är allas ansvar att driva det här företaget.
  
  

Några av våra medarbetare
  
Anna-Mari Ewing
  
Sales Operations Specialist
  
"Om du ger uttryck för dina ambitioner och vad du behöver för stöd, så finns det stora möjligheter att utveckla din karriär med oss."
  
Matilda Alm
  
Account Manager
  
"På Lime trivs jag med fantastiska kollegor och en inspirerande kultur. Möjligheterna att utmanas och växa som säljare gör varje dag spännande och unik."
  
Terry Ilebode
  
Software Engineer
  
"Lime ger mig ett holistiskt stöd i alla delar av mitt liv genom att både utmana mig som mjukvaruutvecklare och ge mig stöd i min personliga utveckling."
  
Henrik Kjærvik
  
Head of Expert Services
  
"Det bästa med att jobba på Lime, förutom kollegorna så klart, är flexibiliteten och möjligheterna att utveckla din karriär i linje med dina egna mål och ambitioner."
  
Kvalifikationer
  
  

Vem är du?
  
  

Du har 2–3 års erfarenhet av B2B-försäljning
  
Om du har erfarenhet av SaaS-/mjukvaruförsäljning är det ett stort plus
  
Utbildning? Yes. Vi tror att du har en bachelor eller master inom Business Administration, eller motsvarande
  
Du har ett intresse för IT/tech/SaaS och en vilja att lära mer

Du drivs av mål och är resultatorienterad

Helt ödmjukt kan vi berätta att vi har en fantastisk kultur på Lime!Vi firar framgång och när vi når våra mål bjuder vi med alla kollegor på en stor sommarfest. Vi har ingen deadline för denna roll utan är flexibla med din start. För oss är det snarare viktigt att hitta rätt person som är redo att skapa bättre förutsättningar för framtida kunder ute på marknaden.

title: System Architect
description:
**Who We Are**
--------------

  

At Volvo Cars, we are committed to transforming the automotive industry through advanced technology and innovative software solutions. Within our Connected Experience (ConX) unit, we focus on building and refining the ConX Software Factory, a platform dedicated to continuous integration and continuous deployment (CICD) for our entire software development ecosystem. Our goal is to create a seamless developer experience by implementing cutting-edge tools, coding practices, and processes that align with our governance and quality standards. We value collaboration, technical leadership, and continuous improvement to ensure that every piece of software we develop meets the highest Volvo Cars standards.

  

**What You'll Do**
------------------

  

As a System Architect for ConX eART Solution Integration and Release, you will lead the product lifecycle of the ConX Software Factory from a technical perspective. You will define and document the system architecture, working closely with the eART Technology Manager to ensure the product roadmap aligns with technological feasibility. Collaborating with various business units and product ARTs, you will foster an inner-source approach and align automation and integration processes across Volvo Cars’ entire ecosystem.


Your role will involve driving technology innovation, resolving technical debt, and ensuring that the ConX Software Factory follows the Unified Software Factory concept. You will work on cost-efficient strategies for technical solutions and hosting, while continuously improving the platform's performance and cost-effectiveness. Additionally, you will define KPIs that transparently reflect service quality and ensure that best practices in software engineering are consistently followed.

  

**Who You Are**
---------------

  

You are a highly experienced technical leader with at least three years in an architect role within an automotive Software Factory, CICD environment, or another complex product ecosystem focused on automation and testing. With more than five years of experience as a software engineer in embedded development, you are deeply familiar with CICD processes and product development cycles. You excel at cross-functional collaboration, effectively managing diverse stakeholders, and simplifying complex technical concepts for non-technical teams.


You have a passion for coaching software developers at various levels and driving continuous improvement in product performance and technical quality. Your problem-solving mindset allows you to identify and address technical debts proactively. Experience in testing product quality, security, and relevant certification standards further strengthens your profile.


If you are driven by technical leadership, collaboration, and innovation, this role offers an exceptional opportunity to shape the future of software development at Volvo Cars. Join us to build the next generation of automotive software solutions and drive continuous improvement in our ConX Software Factory.
company_description: At Volvo Car Group, our vision is clear: "To be the world's most progressive and desired premium car brand".

title: Maintenance Engineer - Martin and Servera
description:
Job Introduction

We are looking for a Maintenance Engineer to join our residential maintenance team at the Martin and Servera site in Norrköping.


The TGW solution comprises a shuttle system with more than 35,000 storage locations in two temperature zones (ambient and chilled temperature). In order to utilise the available surface to its full extent, totes are stored triple-deep. An automatic mini-load warehouse with 11,000 storage locations and Mustang E+ storage and retrieval machines is used for replenishment. The site is monitored and maintained by 3 Maintenance Engineers and a Team Lead who work in a shift pattern from Monday to Friday.


* 05:00 – 14:00
* 11:00 – 20:00
* 14:00 – 23:00


The Maintenance Engineer supports our customer on all automation-related topics according to the agreed scope of supply. They provide a broad-based electrical, mechanical, controls, and software technical ability along with a right-first-time mentality and a proactive approach to identifying ways to improve the site’s performance, i.e. fulfilling the contractual SLA.

  


Main Responsibilities
* Execute scheduled Preventive Maintenance tasks.
* Resolve breakdown situations (Corrective Maintenance) - with support on more technical elements.
* Ensure high levels of housekeeping, never compromise on safety first.
* Support the automation to operate at its maximum efficiency.
* Complete all necessary reports, including those for shift maintenance tasks, spare parts usage, and toploss, while working in DART and CMMS software platforms.
* Continually improve the performance of the equipment through avenues such as toploss activities and design modifications.
* Actively seek root cause when remedying any breakdowns on TGW-supplied equipment and software.
* Supporting with flow control activities.

About You
* You have an Engineering Qualification
* You have general knowledge of mechanics or electrical or control
* You have an understanding of maintenance processes
* You are customer-focused
* You can work in a time-critical environment
* You are not afraid to work at heights
* You are available to work flexible shift patterns
* You have an excellent command of the Swedish language.

We Offer
* Permanent Contract with a competitive salary and paid overtime
* Life Assurance: 4 x Yearly Salary
* The employee is entitled to pension and social insurance benefits (sick pay and parental pay) in accordance with Swedish law and the Collective Agreement, Tekniktjänsteavtalet.
* Employee Assistance Programme
* The amount of annual vacation is 25 working days and the Employee is entitled to a vacation pay of 0,8% of the monthly gross salary per vacation day.
* Health care allowance and a free annual health check
