title: Onsite Support Specialist
description:
**Join us and contribute to the world’s transition to a green and sustainable future!**  

Do you posses experience and passion for providing IT Technical Support? Then we might have the right job for you! We are looking for a highly motivated Onsite Support Specialist placed in Karlskrona.

**Strengthen our Group IT Organization**  

NKT is growing and to support the business growth with efficient and secure IT.  

We are looking for an Onsite Support Specialist with experience in service desk, on-site support, systems administration or similar positions.


Your primary tasks will be:

* Ensures user support for end-to-end IT services
* Handling of requests for new IT equipment/software and coordination of regular hardware exchange
* Handle deployment and maintenance of standard hardware (IT & Telco devices) and software (incl. new releases, patches
* Support maintaining IT standards for hardware and software

 **Communicative candidate with good customer service skills**


To do well in this position, you need to be a person who has good customer service skills and a motivated team member. Equally important is that you like collaborating and sharing experiences with the colleagues. Moreover, you prefer to work in an international and diverse setting.


Additionally, your CV includes:

* Education in Computer Science or relevant field
* ITIL certification is essential
* 2+ years of previous experience in service desk, on-site support, systems administration or similar position
* Fluency in spoken and written Swedish and English is mandatory
* Microsoft certifications, not mandatory but beneficial.

**Join us for a greener future**  

NKT is committed to fostering a diverse organization and a culture where people from different backgrounds can thrive and are inspired to perform at their best. We believe that a diverse organization enables sustainable performance, and that an inclusive and welcoming culture makes for a better place to work.


This role will offer you great possibilities to contribute to our growth journey. You will gain exciting opportunities to develop your own career.  

Sound interesting? Then we’d like to speak to you. Even if you don’t tick all the boxes – let us know. Knowledge gaps can be filled and the most important thing is your potential, motivation and eager to contribute to our future growth. Read more about our offer and listen to some voices of NKT Connectors here!

**Contact and application**  

We will review applications continuously but we recommend you to apply no later than 2025-01-05. Be aware that personality tests, cognitive tests and background checks might be included in the recruitment process. If you have any questions regarding the position, you are welcome to contact Recruiter Agnes Carlsson, agnes.carlsson@nkt.com. Please note that due to the GDPR regulations we cannot accept any applications via e-mail.

**Union Representatives**  

Sveriges Ingenjörer - Christian Fisch, +46 455 56 380


Unionen – Joakim Wikström +46 734 070 243


Ledarna - Roger Jönsson, +46 455 55 911

  

Welcome with your application!  

**Be a Connector of the green tomorrow!**

  

#LI-AC2

**About NKT**


At the factory in Karlskrona, NKT is designing, developing and manufacturing the high-voltage power cable solutions enabling the transition to renewable energy. Here, you will join a diverse organization at an internationally recognized engineering center operating one of the most advanced high-voltage test halls, a state-of-the-art cable manufacturing and the NKT Victoria – the most sustainable cable-laying vessel in the offshore industry.


At NKT, we are all Connectors. We connect to develop leading technologies that enable the world’s transition to renewable energy - and we stay connected to grow as people and professionals. As a company, NKT connects a greener world with high-quality power cable technology and takes centre stage as the world moves towards green energy. NKT designs, manufactures and installs low-, medium- and high-voltage power cable solutions enabling sustainable energy transmission. NKT is headquartered in Denmark and employs 5.000 people. NKT is listed on Nasdaq Copenhagen and realised a revenue of EUR 2.6 billion in 2023. We connect a greener world. www.nkt.com

Germany: Düsseldorfer Straße 400, Im Chempark, 51061 Köln
company_description: Do you want to play a leading role in the green transition? Do you want to enable to continued electrification of society? Then join us on our journey and become an NKT Connector.

title: Senior HIL Test Engineer
description:
Join our dynamic team at ALTEN Gothenburg, Sweden, where we collaborate with leading automotive manufacturers on cutting-edge research and development projects. We’re excited to expand our team of automotive software test engineers and invite passionate individuals like you to join us!


In the rapidly evolving field of testing, automation is the future, and we’re seeking talented individuals with expertise in automotive software testing or development. If you have experience in automotive software test automation, we’d love to hear from you.

 *Please note that this position requires a relocation to Sweden.*

 **What we offer you**


ALTEN’s automotive division works with several automotive OEMs and suppliers. In Gothenburg, Sweden, we have an automotive hub working with many exciting projects spanning over domains such as:

* Electronics and Electrical
* Electromobility
* Autonomous Drive & ADAS
* Infotainment and Connectivity



**Your profile**


To excel in this role, we see that you have a relevant technical education e.g. a M.Sc. or a B.Sc. within Electrical/Embedded Systems, Electronics, Physics, Mechatronics, Software Engineering or similar


Moreover, we see that you have:

* Minimum 5 years of experience in HIL testing and/or configuring HIL benches
* Working experience with HIL environments such as Vector or dSpace
* Working experience with Vector tools (vTestStudio, CANoe, CANalyzer etc.) and/or dSpace tools (ControlDesk, ConfigurationDesk)
* Knowledge in vehicle communication such as CAN, LIN, Flexray, Ethernet
* Fluent in English and can communicate effectively with all types of stakeholders

  

Meritorious experience:

* Programming skills in Matlab & Simulink, CAPL
* Requirement management tools (DOORS, Polarion, SystemWeaver etc.)
* ECU signalling and automotive electrical systems
* Swedish driver’s license

***Please note: Due to Christmas holidays, there will be no selection until January 2, 2025. Happy holidays!***

  

As a consultant engineer at ALTEN, you’ll thrive by being analytical, quality-focused, and collaborative. If you’re ready for an exciting opportunity to contribute to ground-breaking automotive projects and be part of a supportive team environment, we encourage you to apply today. Your unique skills and perspective are essential to our success!

  

ALTEN is one of Europe’s largest technology and IT consulting companies with over 57,000 employees in 30 countries. Our engineers carry out complex and highly technical projects throughout the value chain of the most prestigious companies in all sectors, such as Automotive, Defense, Energy & Environment, Industry, Public services & Government and Life Sciences. In Sweden, we are about 1300 committed employees with 9 offices in 9 cities – from Lund in the south to Skellefteå in the north.


For the fifth year in a row, ALTEN has been named one of Sweden’s most attractive employers by Karriärföretagen, an award for employers that offer unique career and development opportunities.


  
Jobb detaljer
13/12/2024
Göteborg
Rekrytering Kontakt
ALTEN Sweden
recruitment@alten.se

title: Account Manager
description:
Urval sker löpande Lund Arbete på plats
  
  

Har du insett att försäljning och affärsutveckling är ditt home turf? Vill du sälja mjukvara som optimerar förutsättningarna för dina kunder att bli sina bästa jag? Är du en hunter som drivs av resultat och personlig utveckling? Perfekt! Just nu letar vi efter dig som vi bli en del av vårt härliga säljteam i Lund. Välkommen till Lime!
  
  

Vad kommer du att göra?
  
  

Som Account Manager ansvarar du för hela säljprocessen från första kontakt till ett färdigt förhandlat avtal, och alla steg däremellan. Hos Lime prospekterar vi, bokar egna möten, kvalificerar kund, demar lösningen, och stänger affären.
  
  

Då vi säljer CRM-system med tillhörande konsulttjänster kan du se fram emot komplexa försäljningsprocesser där din uppgift är att hitta och övertyga kunden, men också att identifiera deras behov och utamningar för att kunna definiera specifika lösningar. Du kan förvänta dig kontakt med C-levelpersoner på landets medelstora och stora företag inom olika branscher genom uppsökande försäljningsarbete, såsom:
  
  

Prospektering på såväl varma som kalla leads
  
Nätverkande / relationsförsäljning
  
Konferenser och mässor
  
Kundmöten och presentationer både fysiskt och digitalt
  
Säljprocesser med fokus på att skapa värde i kundens arbetsprocesser
  
Social selling, eller på det vis som ger dig bäst resultat
  
  

Vilka är vi?
  
  

Först och främst måste vi såklart skryta lite om vår fantastiska kultur här på Lime! Vi jobbar hårt, men vi ser också till att ha riktigt kul tillsammans. Vi är något kända för vår berömda fika-kultur och varje fredag får vi njuta av nybakat från vår fantastiska Office Manager - veckans höjdpunkt! Pauserna spenderas gärna vid pingisbordet, där intensiva matcher avgörs dagligen, eller med våra träningsglada kollegor som gärna tar en löptur över lunchen.
  
  

Du kommer bli en del av vår lokala säljorganisation i Lund med 20 kollegor inom sälj och totalt cirka 150 kollegor på kontoret. Förutom detta kommer du få runt 70 härliga säljkollegor totalt i Sverige och runt 500 kollegor runt om i Europa. Hos oss karaktäriseras säljkulturen av människor som vill bygga ett starkt team och samtidigt drivs av den individuella prestationen. Vi hjälps åt och det är allas ansvar att driva det här företaget.
  
  

Några av våra medarbetare
  
Anna-Mari Ewing
  
Sales Operations Specialist
  
"Om du ger uttryck för dina ambitioner och vad du behöver för stöd, så finns det stora möjligheter att utveckla din karriär med oss."
  
Matilda Alm
  
Account Manager
  
"På Lime trivs jag med fantastiska kollegor och en inspirerande kultur. Möjligheterna att utmanas och växa som säljare gör varje dag spännande och unik."
  
Terry Ilebode
  
Software Engineer
  
"Lime ger mig ett holistiskt stöd i alla delar av mitt liv genom att både utmana mig som mjukvaruutvecklare och ge mig stöd i min personliga utveckling."
  
Henrik Kjærvik
  
Head of Expert Services
  
"Det bästa med att jobba på Lime, förutom kollegorna så klart, är flexibiliteten och möjligheterna att utveckla din karriär i linje med dina egna mål och ambitioner."
  
Kvalifikationer
  
  

Vem är du?
  
  

Du har 2–3 års erfarenhet av B2B-försäljning
  
Om du har erfarenhet av SaaS-/mjukvaruförsäljning är det ett stort plus
  
Utbildning? Yes. Vi tror att du har en bachelor eller master inom Business Administration, eller motsvarande
  
Du har ett intresse för IT/tech/SaaS och en vilja att lära mer
  
Du tycker om att arbeta proaktivt mot marknaden, med örat mot marken hittar du bästa sätt att nå ut; cold calling, social selling, eller något helt annat
  
Du drivs av mål och är resultatorienterad
  
Du har uthållighet och GRIT
  
Du har körkort
  
  

Vad erbjuder vi?
  
  

Helt ödmjukt kan vi berätta att vi har en fantastisk kultur på Lime!
  
  

Vi firar framgång och när vi når våra mål bjuder vi med alla kollegor på en stor sommarfest. Vi har utöver det en årlig julfest, frukost varje måndag, daglig trefika, smoothie-onsdag, gofika på fredagar samt wellness- och aktivitetsgrupper på respektive kontor som anordnar gemensamma aktiviteter. Vi tycker om att umgås med varandra – att ha kul och att prestera går hos oss hand i hand!
  
  

Förutom allt detta erbjuder vi kollektivavtal, sex veckors semester, friskvårdsbidrag, pension samt stora möjligheter till personlig utveckling.
  
  

När kan du börja?
  
  

Vi har ingen deadline för denna roll utan är flexibla med din start. För oss är det snarare viktigt att hitta rätt person som är redo att skapa bättre förutsättningar för framtida kunder ute på marknaden.
  
  

Processen?
  
  

Vi tillämpar löpande urval, vilket innebär att vi driver rekryteringsprocessen kontinuerligt tills vi hittat den perfekta matchningen. I första steget screenar vi din ansökan. Därefter följer intervjuer, ett praktiskt case samt referenstagning. Vår process avslutas alltid med slutintervju med vår VD Nils.
  
  

Konferenser och sociala aktiviteter
  
  

Träning och utveckling
  
  

Balans i (jobb)livet
  
  

Kaffe, dricka och fika
  
  

Hälsa och välmående
  
  

Bygga Lime tillsammans
  
  

Om företaget
  
  

Lime är ett börsnoterat techbolag med 9 kontor i 6 länder. Vi växer konstant med ca 20 % per år och öppnade under hösten 2020 vårt första utomnordiska kontor i Nederländerna. Sedan dess har vi äntrat Tyskland och har ständigt ögonen öppna för nya, potentiella marknader. Men det där är bara siffror och fakta. Det riktigt härliga med Lime är vi som jobbar här - ett stort gäng omtänksamma, ambitiösa kollegor som kämpar för en värld där alla kundupplevelser överträffar förväntningarna. Med hjälp av smart teknik och träffsäker expertis förenklar vi kunders vardag och skapar förutsättningar för det där lilla extra. Något som fortfarande är unikt för ett mjukvarubolag som Lime är också att vi sköter hela produktlivscykeln själva - allt från utveckling, till leverans, till support. Vi tar helt enkelt ansvar för att kedjan är hel och välfungerande, med en twist. Vi kallar det #dontbreakthechain.
  
  

Lime grundades av tre studenter i Lund år 1990
  
  

Lime klimatkompenserar genom grön el från en solcellspark utanför Sjöbo
  
  

Lime har gjort sex företagsförvärv sedan år 2017
  
  

Limes nuvarande VD Nils började som en av de första traineerna år 2006
  
  

Lime introducerades på Nasdaq i Stockholm år 2018
  
  

Lime lanserade sitt omvända mentorskapsprogram år 2019
  
  

Limes mjukvara har en räckvidd på ca 100 miljoner människor dagligen
  
  

Sara Pennsäter Åkesson | Kontaktperson
company_description: Looking for a boring employer? Look elsewhere! At Lime, we love customer care, sales and case management! We love to deliver that “something special” – while having a lot of fun along the way.

title: Integration Platform Specialist
description:
Benify is an international HR tech company that provides a market-leading global benefit and total rewards platform. With over 550 Benifyers in 6 countries, we're driving success with over 1500 customers and approximately three million users around the world . We empower people to be the best they can be while fostering a sustainable and engaging work culture where employees feel engaged and included "Because People Matter" .
  
At Benify, we have created a world-class integration platform! The capabilities of the platform includes API gateways, messaging, and a low-code integration tool! And, of course, logging and monitoring tools. In the integration platform we are using open-source products to a very large extent.
  
Responsibilities
  
Asan Integration Platform Specialist, you will work with a variety of interesting and leading-edge integration components, tools, and setups within our Integration Platforms team. Your workdays will be filled with various, fast-paced, and stimulating tasks in a dynamic and diverse work environment together with motivated people. You will work with internal and external parties and support our customers with new/updated functionality and solve existing challenges in our integration landscape. You will be supporting our development teams with integration expertise, and you will have a shared responsibility for further developing and maintaining our integration landscape. In this role experience of REST API design is a must.
  
In your daily work, you will support agile teams and cross-functionally with other teams spread across multiple geographic locations to deliver the right data flow and flexible solutions for our clients, and you will monitor and improve our technical setup. You will work within the Integration team and work closely with the head of Integration Platforms.
  
Benify is practicing API First design methodology.
  
  

**AsIntegration Platform Specialit, you will also:**  

Support development teams and our customer integration teams in REST APIs, messaging, and low-code development, most often as a sounding board and/or reviewer
  
Further develop the capabilities of our low code integration platform
  
Participate in overseeing operations and support our internal teams with operational information
  
Participate in day-to-day operations of the integration platform, including patches, admin and more
  
Manage CI/CD toolchains
  
Update info on our Developer Portal
  
Educate developers in our tools
  
  

Personal attributes
  
We are seeking someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment, takes ownership of their work, and enjoys tackling complex technical challenges. You should have a genuine passion for problem-solving, taking initiative, and being proactive, detail-oriented, and committed to continuously improving processes and tools. A collaborative mindset and strong communication skills are essential, as you will be working with diverse teams across multiple geographies.
  
  

We also see that you have
  
Software engineer degree, preferably BSc in computer science or equal
  
REST API design experience
  
Programming experience in JavaScript/TypeScript and Python. Experience in Java and LUA is a plus.
  
Professional proficiency in English, both written and spoken. Any additional languages are welcomed in our global company
  
  

It's a , thus not a requirement if you also got...
  
Messaging design experience (AsyncAPI)
  
Configuration of GitHub CI/CD tools
  
IdP (Identity provider) tools/systems experience
  
  

Perks of being a Benifyer
  
Guaranteed work-life balance with a hybrid working model
  
Collective agreement
  
Generous wellness allowance
  
30 days vacation
  
ITP1 pension
  
Lifeplan - a leading financial advisory service that offers personalized advice for maximizing your pension savings
  
  

Practical information
  
**Start:** As soon as we find the right match! Extent: Full-time, 100%Location: Stockholm or Gothenburg, Sweden.
  
Apply by submitting your CV and/or your LinkedIn profile using the application form below. We screen applications continuously and may hire someone before the last application date.
  
Please let us know if you need any reasonable adjustments for interviews by replying to the email you will receive after you apply.

title: Calculation engineer
description:
We're looking for you who finds inspiration in simulation driven product development and calculation of welded structures. Does this spark your interest? Join our calculation and simulation team at Toyota Material Handling!
  
  

In the position as a Calculation Engineer at Toyota, you will look forward to:
  
FEM-analyses of both complete forklift models and subsystems
  
Optimizations and simulations
  
Developing load cases and boundary conditions
  
Method development
  
As a Calculation Engineer with us, you'll work on projects across our full range of products, from hand trucks to warehouse forklift trucks with lifting capacities exceeding 16 meters. You'll be involved in both new development projects and optimization tasks for existing machinery, as well as custom-designed vehicles. Your responsibilities will include both static and dynamic strength analysis, with welded structures being a central part. You'll play a key role in the development process by evaluating and analyzing results, particularly fatigue, and work on improvements together with designers to achieve projects goals.
  
  

Your Profile
  
A master's degree in mechanical engineering or Vehicle Engineering with specialization in applied mechanics or strength of materials. Alternatively, a similar education or equivalent work experience.
  
Experience as a Calculation Engineer or similar.
  
Strong analytical abilities, attention to detail, and excellent communication skills.
  
Proficiency in Altair HyperWorks, Optistruct, or similar software.
  
Proficiency in both spoken and written English. Proficiency in Swedish is a plus.
  
We are looking for you who are curious and have an eye for improvement work, as a significant aspect of the role involves method development. Our vision is to reduce lead times in our project development by closing the gap between simulation and testing. Here you'll have the opportunity to work closely with our test engineers in our lab. If you value collaboration and are eager to contribute to a team where knowledge sharing is central, this position is for you!
  
Who is R&D Toyota Material Handling?
  
Toyota Material Handling is a world leader in material handling and we are making large investments to meet the needs of the future. At our R&D department in Mjölby, 300 employees work on the development of our products and services as well as new innovative solutions. At Toyota, we work with a holistic perspective where employees have responsibility from concept to finished product.
  
  

At Toyota, we combine classic design with modern technology in automation, IoT and AI. Our product portfolio ranges from manual hand trucks to driverless vehicles with advanced technology. In the R&D department, we work with short development cycles to meet the demand of a rapidly growing market.
  
Together, we work in cross-functional teams with agile working methods. Everyday life at R&D alternates between theory and practice, with great opportunities for our engineers to test their new technical solutions in practice in our extensive modern test lab. Our large-scale production lies side by side with R&D, which creates good conditions for direct feedback from the practical application of the products.
  
The employees in R&D describe our managers and leaders as inclusive, attentive and without prestige. We at Toyota are keen to create a familiar working climate with opportunities for personal development and good career prospects.
  
  

Application
  
Welcome with your application no later than 2025-01-03.
  
If you are applying for a job and have a protected identity you should contact HR, who will guide you further for a secure application process.
  
  

**For more information please contact:**  

Robin Bruder, manager Analysis and Simulation, +46761177978
  
Ellen du Rietz, Talent Acquistion Partner, ellen.durietz@toyota-industries.eu

title: CAM Manufacturing Engineer - Additiv tillverkning Till GKN Aerospace
description:
Om företaget
  
Varje gång du flyger, nästan var som helst i världen, är det troligt att GKN Aerospace hjälper dig på vägen. Vår
  
teknologi och våra komponenter används i 90% av världens flygplan, i allt från små och stora passagerarflygplan,
  
affärsjets samt i världens mest avancerade stridsflygplan. Vi designar och tillverkar även innovativa komponenter till
  
rymdsystem. Vi utvecklas ständigt, banar väg för ny teknik och utmanar oss själva för att bli bättre i allt vi gör.
  
Vi söker drivna och passionerade medarbetare som vill göra en skillnad! Var med och påverka den hållbara
  
omvandlingen av flygindustrin och hitta en plats där din karriär tar fart i en värld av enorma möjligheter att lära och
  
utvecklas.
  
  

Tjänstebeskrivning
  
As a key member of our small, dynamic team at GTC, you will play a vital role in advancing
  
method and technology development while contributing to the creation of innovative
  
demonstrators. Our team supports GKN's broader organization by tackling machining-related
  
challenges, engaging in diverse research projects, and collaborating with leading companies and
  
universities.
  
Your primary focus will be on CAM engineering, but your responsibilities will be tailored to your
  
unique skills and expertise. You will have the opportunity to work with state-of-the-art hardware
  
and software, shaping the development of cutting-edge PLM and CAD/CAM environments while
  
driving improvements to existing standards.
  
This role emphasizes developing strategies for Additive Manufacturing, though prior experience in
  
this field is not required—it’s a bonus. If you're eager to push the boundaries of CAM engineering
  
and thrive in a collaborative, innovative environment, we’d love to hear from you!
  
  

**Job Responsibilities:**  

* Actively contribute as a collaborative team member.
* Partner with Senior Research Engineers in national and EU-funded projects.
* Interpret and understand customer requirements, including technical drawings and


specifications related to manufacturing.
  
* Collaborate with design and engineering teams to review CAD models and technical


drawings, providing feedback to enhance manufacturability and improve processes
  
across projects.
  
* Develop and implement CAM programs for CNC machines, including Powder and Wire


Deposition of metallic materials used in Additive Manufacturing.
  
* Design innovative machining setups and establish flexible, low-volume machining


strategies.
  
* Create and optimize tool paths, machining strategies, and tooling solutions to improve


efficiency and performance.
  
* Conduct simulations and analyses to validate CAM programs, ensuring compliance with


quality and safety standards.
  
* Train and mentor CAM engineers, offering technical guidance and support.
* Stay informed about advancements in CAM software and manufacturing technologies,


applying new knowledge to enhance processes.
  
  

Kvalifikationer
  
* Proven experience in manufacturing and production processes.
* Preferably, expertise in NC programming, particularly using NX software.
* Extensive hands-on experience in manufacturing and operating machining equipment.
* Open-minded with a focus on continuous improvement and innovation.
* Strong interpersonal skills, adaptability, and an independent work style to thrive in


collaborative settings.
  
* Proficiency in English is required; Swedish language skills are a plus.
* A positive attitude with a willingness to share knowledge and train others.


Låter det intressant?
  
Har du frågor, så tveka inte att ringa ansvarig rekryterare Nathalie Stenman Nyberg tel 0707-858413. Din ansökan skickar du in via NearYous hemsida, www.nearyou.se snarast. Vi jobbar med löpande urval, så skicka gärna din ansökan idag.
  
  

Med anledning av nya dataskyddsförordningen GDPR, ber vi dig att utesluta de sista fyra siffrorna i ditt personnummer samt eventuella referenskontakter i din ansökan/CV.
  
  

Välkommen med din ansökan!
  
  

Om NearYou
  
NearYou är ett rekryterings- och bemanningsföretag med kontor i 17 städer. Vi har gått från att vara ett bolag bland andra i branschen till att också bli en samhällsaktör. Med oss som partner och arbetsgivare lovar vi att ge mer av det vi är bäst på. Vi är bäst på att vara nära, mänskliga och en motpol till stress, människor som statistik och en alltför opersonlig digitalisering. Vi är hos dig, ett handslag, ett löfte. För dig som kandidat innebär det en aktör som backar dig, oavsett var i karriären du är och vill vara. Vi vill vara tryggheten i en snabb värld. Vi stöttar, utmanar och frågar hur det går. Helt naturligt, tycker vi. Läs gärna mer om oss på www.nearyou.se
  
  

Att arbeta som konsult på NearYou
  
Som konsult hos NearYou är du anställd hos oss och arbetar ute hos någon av våra kunder. För oss är det viktigt att erbjuda en trygg och hållbar anställning för alla våra anställda. Du har samma fördelar och trygghet som hos en traditionell arbetsgivare och du omfattas av kollektivavtalens villkor för till exempel lön, försäkringar, pension och semester.
  
  

Som konsult hos oss får du en konsultchef som hjälper dig i ditt val av uppdrag och ger dig tips och råd hur du kan utvecklas i arbetslivet. Du får även möta olika företagskulturer och får erfarenhet från olika branscher, vilket gör att du utvecklar din kompetens och ditt nätverk och gör dig till en mer attraktiv medarbetare.

title: Mechanical Component System Engineer
description:
We are seeking a **Mechanical Component System Engineer** with a strong background in mechanical engineering and component development and expertise in supplier collaboration. Experience in process/thermohydraulic fields, heat exchanger design, or rotating machine design is highly desirable. This role focuses on overseeing supplier designs, ensuring alignment with technical requirements, manufacturing capabilities, and seamless system integration. The successful candidate will play a vital role in coordinating design teams, suppliers, and project stakeholders to deliver high-quality mechanical components for complex systems.

 **What we do at Blykalla**

*At Blykalla, we’re transforming the future of nuclear power by developing innovative Small Modular Reactors (SMRs). Our mission is to create a new generation of nuclear energy systems that are safer, more efficient, and environmentally friendly. As Sweden’s only developer of SMRs, we’re at the forefront of a groundbreaking industry.*

 **What you’ll get to do**

* Act as the primary technical interface with suppliers, ensuring compliance with specifications, standards, and project requirements.
* Review and provide detailed feedback on supplier designs, including material selection, manufacturing processes, and system compatibility.
* Monitor supplier progress, resolve technical issues, and ensure timelines are met for design, testing, and delivery.
* Ensure supplier designs integrate seamlessly with system requirements, assessing impacts on performance, reliability, and process/thermohydraulic behavior.
* Participate in supplier qualification processes, audits, and quality assurance activities.
* Coordinate and witness key tests such as **Factory Acceptance Tests (FAT)** and **Site Acceptance Tests (SAT)**.
* Provide technical oversight during commissioning and startup phases, ensuring component readiness and system functionality.
* Collaborate with internal and external teams to align supplier deliverables with overall system engineering objectives.
* Maintain comprehensive documentation, including technical reviews, testing protocols, and commissioning reports.

 **Who you are**


You will be part of a highly skilled team with a can-do attitude. We value personnel chemistry and strive to create a workplace where you enjoy coming to. There are however a few things that we think will help you to succeed in this role, these are:

* A Master’s degree in, Nuclear, Mechanical, Chemical or Aerospace Engineering, or a related field.
* Proven experience working with suppliers on design reviews and technical follow-ups.
* Strong knowledge of materials, manufacturing processes, and thermohydraulic principles.
* Experience with testing, commissioning, and FAT/SAT processes.
* Familiarity with international standards (e.g., ASME, ISO).
* Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.
* Highly organized with attention to detail.
* Proactive problem-solving approach.
* Adaptability to fast-paced and dynamic projects.
* Fluent in English, both spoken and written (Swedish is a plus).

 **Meritorious skills:**


The following skills are not required but will be considered an advantage:

* Experience with system engineering, including requirements management.
* Background in the nuclear, aerospace, or energy sectors.
* Understanding of FEA software tools like ANSYS, Nastrans, STAR CCM+ etc.
* Understanding of process simulator tools like ASPEN, AFT, Flownex, Flomaster, etc.
* Knowledge of advanced materials, such as high-performance alloys.
* Experience with project management for supplier coordination.

 **Location**

This position is for our office in Stockholm.

 **So, what do you think?**


Joining our team means being part of a supportive and innovative environment where your ideas are valued and your expertise is recognized. You will have the opportunity to work with industry leaders and contribute to the safe and sustainable use of nuclear power.

 *Note: We encourage applicants from diverse backgrounds and are an equal-opportunity employer.*

 **Due to GDPR, we do not accept applications over email.**

  

We are not open to external help from recruitment agencies.

title: Mechanical Design Engineer
description:
**Techster Solutions** befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst **2+** års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.

  

Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.

  

Rollbeskrivning:

**What You Will Do**  

As a Design/CAD Engineer within the Vehicle Product & Release team in the Energy Management department, you will play a crucial role in the hardware development. You will work with issues related to current production as well as new projects covering quality, cost and technology. You will work close to the other team members, collaborate with different interfaces within VCC and work close with suppliers.  

  

Key Responsibilities  

* Design Engineering: Focus on hardware development and addressing production issues.
* Packaging Work: Ensuring components fit well within the vehicle design.
* Part Number Administration: Managing part numbers in Volvo's systems.
* Releasing Documentation: Creating and releasing 2D drawings and 3D models.
* Collaboration: Working closely with both internal teams and suppliers.

  

**Required Qualifications**  

* Education: Bachelor’s degree in engineering or equivalent experience.
* Experience: Minimum of 2 years in product development.
* Technical Skills:


o Proficiency in Catia (CAD software).  

o Strong understanding of vehicle components and systems.  

* Language Skills: Fluent in English, both spoken and written.
* Additional Knowledge: Familiarity with design in plastics and electrical components is a plus. Previous experience at Volvo is beneficial.

  

Personal Qualities  

* Organized: Methodical and structured in approach.
* Communication: Strong skills in conveying ideas and educating others.
* Curiosity and Drive: Eager to learn and innovate.
* Team Player: Ability to work independently and collaboratively as part of a development team.
* Customer Focused: Prioritizes the needs and satisfaction of customers.
**Ansökan**  

Tror du att du är **Techster Solutions** nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.

**Arbetsplats och kultur**
--------------------------


Vi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.


Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Software Test Engineer
description:
**Techster Solutions** befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst **5+** års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.

  

Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.

  

Rollbeskrivning:  

  

**Who you are**  

You are customer-focused and passionate for creating top-notch solutions that improve customers' lives! With your strong analytical skills, you are able to evaluate complex problems and identify feasible solutions. Your natural curiosity and creativity enable you to think outside the box and your cooperative approach allows you to work seamlessly with cross-functional teams to achieve common goals.  

  

**What you'll do**  

As a Software Test Engineer, you will be part of a team that ensures our software products meet Volvo’s quality standards. You will create and run test plans and test cases, track software bugs, and work with developers to fix issues. You will also perform regression testing to maintain product stability, build automated test scripts and participate in code reviews. Additionally, you will improve test methodologies and work with continuous integration systems for seamless software deployment.  

  

**Knowledge and experience**  

We're looking for someone with at least **Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or equivalent** experience. You must have **previous experience in quality assurance** of complex **embedded systems** and familiarity with test automation tools such as **Pytest**, **Robot**, **selenium**. It is also required that you have a **valid Swedish driver's license (B)**. Knowledge in tools such as CANoe and CANalyzer is added advantage.  

  

Having experience in automotive and infotainment systems will be viewed as a meritorious qualification for this position.

**Ansökan**  

Tror du att du är **Techster Solutions** nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.

**Arbetsplats och kultur**
--------------------------


Vi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.


Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!
